title: the_new_order:_last_days_of_europe
body:
A popular [[Hearts of Iron]] mod set in an alternate timeline where the Axis won; in which Nazi Germany, struggling to consolidate its power, finds itself in a three-way cold war against America and Japan.

The mod is notable for its detail, incredibly dark tone, and the high risk of a game ending in global thermonuclear war.

title: kaiserreich
body:
[b]Kaiserreich: Legacy of the Weltkrieg[/b] is a mod for the [[Hearts of Iron]] series of games (specifically II, Darkest Hour and IV), set in an alternate timeline where the Central Powers won World War 1, with the German Empire becoming a major Super Power, the Russian Communist Revolution failing, France and Britain's governments being overthrown by a new socialist movement called Syndicalism, and the United States staying neutral during the war.

The mod has been praised by fans for its rich lore and unfolding stories, having been in development since 2005.

title: bashar_al-assad
body:
Bashar al-Assad (Arabic: بشار الأسد) (born 11 September 1965) was a Syrian [[politician]] who was the 19th president of [[Syria]] from 2000 to 2024 (until his defeat in the Syrian Civil War, after which he fled the country to Russia on December 8th). In addition, he was the commander-in-chief of the [[military|Syrian Armed Forces]] and the secretary-general of the Central Command of the Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party. He is a son of [[Hafez al-Assad]], former President of Syria from 1971 to 2000.

h4. See also
* [[Syrian Civil War]]
* [[Tag Group:People]]

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Bashar al-Assad":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bashar_al-Assad
other_names: バッシャール・アル=アサド

title: inugami_korone_(saikyo_tensai_wonderful_world_of_korone)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Inugami Korone]], first introduced in the music video for her first original song [[Saikyo Tensai Wonderful World of Korone]] before being made a full 3D costume for her 2021 birthday 3D live concert.

Ir consists of a [[white choker]], a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress|white]] [[frilled dress|drilled]] [[strapless dress]] with [[layered dress|multiple layers]], an [[underbust]] [[corset]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[back bow]], a [[pink sash]] going from her shoulder to her waist tied into a [[floral bow|floral]] [[waist bow]], [[puffy short sleeves|short]] [[puffy detached sleeves]], [[white gloves|white]] [[frilled gloves]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[red thighhighs|red]] and [[white thighhighs]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[ankle boots]] with [[colored shoe soles]].

Her hairstyle with this costume is her [[inugami korone (1st costume)|regular default hairstyle]] with the addition of a small [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[crow]], [[heart hair ornament|heart]] and [[star hair ornament]]s and a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]] [[ribbon braid|woven into her braids]].

body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Inugami Korone]].

It is a [[viking]] themed costume, consisting of [[leather armor|leather]] [[bikini armor]] with a leather [[single pauldron]] on her right shoulder, [[fur-trimmed bracer|fur-trimmed]] [[bracer]]s, a [[red skirt|red]] [[fur skirt|fur]] [[miniskirt]], [[black thighhighs]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[fur-trimmed boots]] She also has an optional [[blue cape|blue]] [[fur-trimmed cape]] and a [[animal ears helmet]] with dog ears.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[long hair|long]] [[messy hair|messy]] with a [[side braid]] and decorated large [[bone hair ornament|bone]] on her forehead. Her [[dog ears]] are also folded down and blended with her hair, making it quite hard to spot at the first glance.

title: inugami_korone_(wonderland)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Inugami Korone]], debuting in June 7th 2023.

Just like the rest of this round of costumes for [[hololive gamers]], this costume is inspired by [[Alice in Wonderland]], this time being inspired in Alice herself. It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[o-ring choker]] with a [[key necklace]], a [[short dress|short]] [[blue dress]] with a  [[heart-shaped lock]], [[chest belt]], [[chest harness]] and a [[side slit]], a [[white apron|white]] [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[underbust]] [[waist apron]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[checkered skirt]] [[skirt under dress|under her dress]], a small [[potion]] [[vial]] on her waist, a [[black pantyhose|black]] [[fishnet pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots]]. She also an optional [[black jacket|black]] [[letterman jacket|letterman]] [[sukajan]] with [[white sleeves]] and a [[nail bat]] which she carries [[weapon on back|on her back]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[long hair]] tied into a [[two side up]] with a [[black hairband|black]] [[bow hairband]] and [[double-parted bangs]] with [[x hair ornament|crossing]] [[hairclip]]s.

h4. Appearance

title: oklahoma_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the battleship USS [i]Oklahoma[/i] (BB-37) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. 
Character designed by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by [[Uchiyama Yumi]].

h5. Base Art

Oklahoma has [[short hair|short]] [[platinum blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[strapless shirt|strapless]] button-up [[shirt]]. Brown leather with [[fringe trim]] appears to be the material for the rest of her outfit which consists of a shoulder piece, [[detached sleeves]], a [[miniskirt]] with a [[side slit]], and [[knee boots]].

Her [[rigging]] is a split-ship design with her bow on her right, and her stern on her left. Each hull has two [[ship turret|turrets]], a triple barrel turret and a superfiring twin turret. A [[crane_(machine)|mechanical crane]] and a [[smokestack]] are present on her back-rigging. She has a [[utility belt]] holding battleship shells. Several secondary turrets are present, including a handheld turret.

h5. Retrofit Art

In her [[retrofit (azur lane)|retrofit]], she wears a white [[halterneck]] connected to a metal [[collar]], which has an [[anchor]]. Her brown clothing with fringe trim includes a shoulderless [[capelet]] attached to the same place as her halter top, a miniskirt with no slit this time, and some [[leg warmers]]. She wears some thick [[brown gloves]] with fringe trim that flares out, as well as some thinner gloves reaching to about her elbow. 

Her rigging post retrofit experiences a similar change to her sister. She has a twin-hull design with the hull on her right marked with "37," and her turrets adopt a different orientation. On one of her twin-turrets, a [[aircraft catapult]] can be seen.  

h4. Skins

title: noshiro_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Noshiro[/i], introduced in the [i]Swirling Cherry Blossoms[/i] event of December 2019.

She has [[long hair|long]] black hair and [[skin-covered horns]] that [[gradient horns|gradate]] to [[red horns|red]]  and wearing a [[black serafuku]], [[white sailor collar]], and [[pantyhose]]. She is also seen with a [[katana]] slung to her back. A second katana and a [[wakizashi]] are shown on her left/portside rig with a quadruple 61 cm torpedo mount. On her right/starboard rig are her two 15.2 cm twin main gun mounts and a second quad torpedo mount. She also carries 25 mm twin AA mounts on [[thigh strap|thigh straps]].

In real life, she was brought into service as the new flagship of the Second Torpedo Squadron to replace [[Jintsuu (Azur Lane)|]], sunk in Kolombangara. She served in this role until she was sunk in the battle of Leyte Gulf.

Voiced by [[Inami Anju]].

title: northampton_ii_(azur_lane)
body: The personification of the [i]Oregon City[/i]-class heavy cruiser USS [i]Northampton[/i] (CA-125/CLC-1) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i] in her originally planned heavy cruiser configuration. Not to be confused with [[Northampton (Azur Lane)|her namesake predecessor, CA-26]], although it is specified that she has the body and memories of the original but with new equipment and abilities. Compared to the other "revenge ship" namesake, Northampton II features the most noticable design change. Her [[two-tone hair]] now features yellow inner hair instead of blue. Her hair is noticably more voluminous, with her bangs now covering her entire forehead and her left eye. Her outfit consists of a black-and-white [[halterneck]] with [[underboob]] cutout, an assymertical [[short shorts]], a black [[bridal gauntlets]], and a [[military hat]]. Her [[rigging]] is a large wing-shaped device supporting two of her three turrets. h4. Appearance h6. title: northampton_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of USS Northampton (CL/CA-26) which was the lead Northampton-class cruiser in service with the [[United States Navy]]. She was commissioned 17 May 1930 and sunk during the Battle of Tassafaronga on 1 December 1942.

h5. Base Art
[tn]See post #2944064[/tn]
Northampton has [[two-tone hair]], brown outside-cyan inside, lime-[[green eyes]], and [[dark skin]]. Her uniform consists of a white [[halterneck]] with a [[star (symbol)|star]] and a blue [[double vertical stripe]], and an assymetrical pair of white [[short shorts]]. She has a pair of [[red gloves]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[boots]]. In addition she has a [[compression sleeve]] on her left arm and a [[knee brace]] on her right leg.

Her [[rigging]] is exoskeleton-like with two mechanical braces, supporting two of her triple-[[ship turret|turrets]], while the third is hand-held.

title: ping_hai_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the second [i]Ning Hai[/i]-class light cruiser, [i]Ping Hai[/i], in [[Azur Lane]]. Her name (平海) means "amicable sea". 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into [[twintails]] and an [[ahoge]], and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of an [[anchor hair ornament]], [[red dress|red]] dragon print [[China dress|cheongsam]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] on her left leg, [[side-tie panties|side-tie]] [[white panties]], and a [[white jacket]]. Her rigging consists of two hull pieces containing her 140 mm twin gun mounts and additional 76 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s. 

For her retrofit form, see her [[Ping hai (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]


Historically, she was to be built in the Jiangnan Shipyard in Shanghai to plans supplied by the Japanese from building [[Ning Hai (Azur Lane)|]], but rising tensions between the two countries delayed her construction and completion to 1937. Also unlike her sister, [i]Ping Hai[/i] did not have a seaplane complement and carried smaller-caliber AA guns.

Character designed by [[Kinjo Kuromomo]], voiced by [[Kuno Misaki]].

title: ning_hai_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Chinese light cruiser [i]Ning Hai[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Her name (甯海) means "peaceful sea".

Historically, she was patterned after [[Yuubari (Azur Lane)|]] but reduced in size due to budget constraints. Unfortunately, she (and her sister [[Ping Hai (Azur Lane)|]]) inherited the same seakeeping deficiencies as Yuubari and other treaty-skirting warships built by Japan in the interwar period, but the Chinese regarded these as acceptable tradeoffs since they had intended the Ning Hai-class for coastal and Yangtze river use.

For her retrofit form, see her [[Ning hai (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]

title: nautilus_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the US Navy submarine USS [i]Nautilus[/i] (SS-168).

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[blue hair]] with curled [[sidelocks]], and [[yellow eyes]]. She wears a [[one-piece swimsuit|one-piece]] [[black one-piece swimsuit]] with [[detached sleeves]], [[rudder footwear]], and a [[single thighhigh]] on her right leg. Unlike the other Eagle Union submarines, her rig, a [[robot animal|mechanical]] [[narwhal]], is more in line with Ironblood than Eagle Union, but starkly blue in color.

Her hairstyle does lead some players to note a similarity with [[Eula (Genshin Impact)|]], and even reflects in several artworks (e.g. post #4763562).

h4. Skins

* !post #4721415: Default
* !post #4721422: [[nautilus (afternoon stretches) (azur lane)|Afternoon Stretches]]
* !post #6682566: [[nautilus_(shining_blossom_in_the_deep_blue)_(azur_lane)|Shining Blossom in the Deep Blue]]


h4. History
In real life, [i]Nautilus[/i] played an instrumental role in the [[battle of Midway]]: she had tried to attack [[Kirishima (Azur Lane)|]] but was shooed off by the destroyer [i]Arashi[/i] with a depth charge attack. Afterward, [i]Arashi[/i] sped at full speed to rejoin her sister destroyers screening the four Kido Butai carriers, leaving a long white wake for [[Enterprise (Azur Lane)|]]'s dive bomber squadrons, then at the limits of their search, to trail Arashi to the carriers. These dive bombers soon found the carriers in the middle of fending off [[Hornet (Azur Lane)|]] and [[Yorktown (Azur Lane)|]]'s torpedo bomber attacks, leaving no combat air patrol to challenge them in their dive bomb attacks that fatally damaged three of the four carriers.

Later, Nautilus herself tried to attack the burning [[Kaga (Azur Lane)|]] but scored only one dud hit.


h4. Related characters

* [[Arashi (Kancolle)|]], the destroyer who tried to depth-charge Nautilus in the battle of Midway
* [[Yamakaze (Azur Lane)]], who she torpedoed a few weeks after Midway

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: USS [i]Nautilus[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Nautilus_(SS-168)]
other_names: ノーチラス(アズールレーン)

title: naka_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Naka[/i], third and final of the [i]Sendai[/i]-class.

Released in the [i]Crimson Echoes[/i] event on January 2019.

(See post #3363252 for details)
In the game, she has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] and [[yellow eyes]], with [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail|tail]], and wearing the same prevailing style as her sisters: a mix of traditional [[Japanese clothes]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], and white [[thighhighs]].
Her rig carries two 14 cm single guns and two 61 cm twin torpedo mounts, one gun and torpedo mount on each side.

In real life, she was the third out of a planned seven-member class but she was the last one completed due to Washington Naval Treaty restrictions. Even then, she took longer to complete as her original hull was damaged beyond repair in an earthquake in 1923 and had to be rebuilt from scratch. At the start of the war, she led the Fourth Destroyer Squadron and operated alongside her sister [[Jintsuu (Azur Lane)|]] and the Second Destroyer Squadron. While in an operation in the Indian Ocean on April 1, 1942, she was hit by a torpedo from a US submarine that put her out of action for a year. She then operated under different commands before being sunk alongside [[Agano (Azur Lane)|]] in a raid on Truk in February 1944.

title: musketeer_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] M-class destroyer HMS [i]Musketeer[/i] (G86).

h4. History
In real life, [i]Musketeer[/i] was the seventh of eight M-class destroyers built and commissioned. She spent most of her war service on convoy duty in the Arctic and Mediterranean theaters, with the only exception being the battle of the North Cape in December 1943 where [[Scharnhorst (Azur Lane)|]] was sunk.

Post-war, she was the only one of the five surviving M-class destroyers not sold off to Turkey, and was sold for scrap in 1955.

title: mogami_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Mogami[/i].
Voiced by [[Itou Shizuka]].

For her retrofit form, see her [[Mogami (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]


h4. The real-life [i]Mogami[/i]
In real life, [i]Mogami[/i] and her sisters were designed by the IJN as light cruisers under the maximum allowed by the naval treaties in force during her time: 10,000 tons and 15.5 cm main guns.
To save weight, electric welding was used, aluminum was selected for the superstructure, a single trunked funnel was installed instead of two common to the older heavy cruisers, and decent armor. Unfortunately, the extensive weight reductions led to chronic instability while gunnery trials resulted in cracking of the hull welds. As soon as Japan withdrew from the treaty system, the class was taken in hand for a reconstruction that improved their hulls and swapped their 15.5 cm guns for heavier 20.3 cm ones as the class was specifically designed for CL to CA conversion with ease.

In the early Pacific War, she was responsible for the torpedo salvo that accidentally sank army transports in the battle of Sunda Strait, an act that was historically blamed on [[Fubuki (Azur Lane)|]]. Later in the [[battle of Midway]], she accidentally collided with her sister Mikuma, crippling her and leaving her at the mercy of US aircraft from the carriers and Midway itself. The damage sustained by [i]Mogami[/i] justified her selection for conversion to a seaplane cruiser that was completed in April 1943.

Later, she was part of the first wave of ships in the notoriously ill-fated sortie up Surigao Strait. After the first wave under Shouji Nishimura was annihilated (except for Mogami and [i][[Shigure (Azur Lane)|]][/i]), Kiyohide Shima, the admiral leading the second wave, ordered a panicked retreat, causing the flagship [i][[Nachi (Azur Lane)|]][/i] to abruptly swing into the fleeing [i]Mogami[/i]'s path, causing a collision that crippled [i]Mogami[/i]. [i]Mogami[/i] was left behind to be destroyed by American aircraft.

title: mikasa_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Mikasa[/i]. Voiced by [[Oohara Sayaka]].

h4. History
In real life, she is famous for her role as the flagship of the Japanese fleet in the Battle of Tsushima in 1905, where a battle fleet led by Admiral Heihachiro Tougou decisively routed a Russian battle fleet en route to Vladivostok.
Worth noting is the "Z" signal flag on her jacket, a reference to ADM Tougou's famous message to the fleet in the battle using the flag:
[quote]
The Empire's fate depends on the result of this battle, let every man do his utmost duty.
[/quote]

After the war ended, she was sunk by an accidental magazine explosion, then raised, repaired, and modernized before being forced out of service in 1923 to comply with the Washington Naval Treaty. The same treaty also allowed her to be preserved as a museum in Yokosuka under the condition that her hull below the waterline be sealed in concrete.

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #2933426.[/tn]

She is depicted wearing a black [[military uniform]] (which, when observing her sleeve insignia, corresponds to "Marshal Admiral" in the IJN, Tougou's final rank) and wearing a jacket over it with the [[Z flag]] used as a sleeve [[armband]], surrounded by [[prayer beads]].

title: matchless_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] M-class destroyer HMS [i]Matchless[/i] (G52). 
Character designed by [[Alisa (kuro no sakura)]], voiced by Hanamori Yumiri. 

h4. Appearance

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a black [[beret]], [[sleeveless]] [[double-breasted]] [[white shirt]], [[pink ascot]], [[pink skirt]] with a [[black skirt|black inner layer]], [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[smokestack|funnel]] rig worn like a backpack containing her real-life QF 120 mm twin Mk11 [[cannon|gun mount]] and 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]].

h4. History
In real life, [i]Matchless[/i] was the fourth of the M-class destroyers built and commissioned. She initially saw service with the Malta Convoys, including the famed Operation Pedestal where they successfully averted the fall of the besieged island.

Later, she served with the Arctic Convoys, including the battle of the North Cape where [[Scharnhorst (Azur Lane)|]] was sunk. In August 1944, she was briefly paid off into reserve but reactivated later that same month for Mediterranean duties, where she served for the rest of the war. She was sold to Turkey in 1957 and renamed TCG [i]Kiliç (Kilich) Ali Pasha[/i] (D350), serving with them until 1971.

h4. Skins
* !post #3033374: Default
* !post #3536335: [[matchless_(escort_me_please!)_(azur_lane)|Escort Me Please!]] (casual)

h4. M-class destroyers
* [b]Matchless[/b] (G52)
* [[Musketeer (Azur Lane)|]] (G86)

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: HMS [i]Matchless[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Matchless_(G52)]

title: axel_syrios
body:
A [[Holostars English|Holostars EN]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Character design by [[Ginka Sima]].

Axel has [[blonde hair]] with [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and ends, [[blue eyes]], and [[fangs]].

His default attire consists of a [[black shirt]], [[black pants]], [[black jacket]] with orange fringes, [[white belt]], [[black gloves]], and black shoes. He also has black-orange [[fox tail]]s as a belt accessory, [[chain]]s for weapons, and optional holographic [[fake animal ears]] and a black mouth [[mask]].

He is portrayed in-lore as the [[HoloTempus|TEMPUS Guild]]'s gladiator, and the owner of a combat arena. He hails from Northern Elysium (the lore counterpart to Australia) and is the most fluent Japanese speaker of the group, which allows him to serve as a sort of bridge between the JP branch and the EN branch. He has a very notable interest in [[Harusaki Nodoka]], and he eventually gained infamy for his vulgar sense of humor and complete lack of filter, which has led to him developing a reputation as a "VOD destroyer."

h4. Costumes

Magni has dull [[blonde hair]] with [[parted bangs]] and [[yellow eyes]], and he has a [[mole under mouth|mole under his mouth]]. On the right side of his head is a [[purple hair|purple]] [[patterned hair|halo print]], and he also has purple [[spike piercing|spike]] [[piercing|piercings]].

His default attire consists of his six signature [[extra arms]] attached to his [[purple shirt|purple tunic]], [[brown pants]], [[black footwear|black shoes]], a [[black belt]] dividing the shirt top and the tunic side, and [[vambraces]].

title: green_lantern_corps
body: The Green Lantern Corps is a fictional intergalactic law enforcement agency and superhero team appearing in comics published by [[DC Comics]]. They patrol the farthest reaches of the DC Universe at the behest of the Guardians, a race of immortals residing on the planet Oa. According to DC continuity, the Green Lantern Corps have been in existence for three billion years. Currently operating amongst the 3600 "sectors" of the universe, there are 7204 members (known commonly as Green Lanterns). Each [[Green Lantern]] is given a power ring, a weapon granting the use of incredible abilities that are directed by the wearer's own willpower.

title: jessica_cruz
body: Jessica Cruz, one of the characters known as [[Green Lantern]], is a superheroine appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]]. Created by Geoff Johns and Ethan Van Sciver, she is a member of the Green Lantern Corps and [[Justice League]], as well as the first female human Green Lantern. Her first full appearance takes place in Justice League (vol. 2) #31 (August 2014), which is also her first cover appearance. Cruz currently operates out of Portland, Oregon.

title: guy_gardner
body: Guy Gardner, one of the characters known as [[Green Lantern]], is a superhero appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]], usually in association with the [[Green Lantern Corps]], of which he is a member. For a time in the late 1980s and early 1990s, he was also a significant member of the [[Justice League]].

title: hal_jordan
body: A [[DC Comics]] character. A member of the [[green lantern|Green Lantern Corps]]. A former military test pilot, he is now the protector of Sector 2814. He is also a founding member of the [[Justice League]].

title: john_stewart
body: John Stewart is one of the principal fictional superheroes known as [[Green Lantern]] appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]]. The character was created by Dennis O'Neil and Neal Adams, and first appeared in Green Lantern (Volume 2) #87 (December 1971/January 1972). Stewart's original design was based on actor Sidney Poitier and he was one of the first African-American superheroes to appear in DC Comics.

title: alpha_(alpha_1918)
body:
Alpha is a female character designed by [[Findoworld|Findo]] as the anthropomorphic representation of the [[Russian Empire]], first appearing in 2018 as an anime mascot for the Russian nationalist online publication "[[Sputnik and Pogrom]]", whose logo she bears on her left arm on an armband. 

She gained greater notoriety in 2022 after the start of the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]]. She would be drawn opposite to [[Marichka]], and characters made in her wake, such as [[Levchenko Ahapiia Oleksandrivna]], sometimes paired with characters made on her side, such as [[Buhanka-chan]].

Alongside her creation, a Russian-based collaboration group was also created in 2018, comprising of multiple artists and animators, who are working on an animated project centered around her, referred to as "Alpha 1918", otherwise known as the "Russian Anime-Project".

h4. External links

* "Official Website (Russian)":https://alpha1918.moe/
* "Telegram":https://t.me/alpha1918
* "VK":https://vk.com/alpha.research

title: buhanka-chan
body:
Buhanka (more commonly known as Buhanka-chan) is a female character designed as the anthropomorphic representation of the [[UAZ-452]] "Buhanka" vans.

She was designed by an anonymous user, first appearing on 4chan's /ic/ board in February 26th 2022 following the start of the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]].

She is often depicted alongside other characters from the Russian side, such as [[Kamaz-chan]] and [[Alpha (Alpha 1918)|Alpha 1918]], opposite to characters of the opposing side, such as [[Marichka]].

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Buhanka-Chan":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/buhanka-chan
* "Buhanochka Z Telegram":https://t.me/buhanochka_z*

title: mary_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A talented doctor who treats her patients with unsurpassed care. In [[Seraphim (nikke)|]], she is known as the Angel in White. As for patients who disobey her orders, however...

A member and nurse for Seraphim, a medical squad along with [[Pepper (nikke)|]]. [spoiler]Prior to becoming a Nikke, Mary was a nurse who was falsifying the autopsy records of dead patients and selling their brains. A fellow nurse who would later become 'Pepper' discovered this, became infuriated, and killed Mary by pushing her down a flight of stairs.[/spoiler]

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied in a [[braid]] and [[huge breasts]] with [[purple eyes]] which are usually [[closed eyes|closed]]. She wears a [[blue dress|blue]] [[sweater dress]] along with a [[white jacket]] which has an [[armband]] located on the left sleeve, a [[white headwear|headband]] and a pair of [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]].

title: pepper_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A member of [[Seraphim (nikke)|]] along with [[Mary (nikke)|]].

A doctor who takes care of her patients with optimism. She is like a vitamin to Seraphim, and is admired by many as an idol of the hospital. 

She has [[pink eyes]], [[pink hair|pink]] [[short hair with long locks]] and a [[side ponytail]], usually with [[headphones]] over them. Wears a [[sleeveless]] [[white sweater|white]] [[turtleneck sweater|turtleneck]] [[ribbed sweater]], with a [[sailor collar]] and a [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]] on top. She wears her [[weapon on back| weapon on her back]] with a [[strap]]. She wears [[white gloves|white]] and [[black gloves]].

title: neon_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

A member of the [[Counters (nikke)|]], along with [[Rapi (nikke)|]] and [[Anis (nikke)|]], Neon is a simple-minded airhead who adores firepower, thus earning herself the title of "Queen of Firepower."

She is a [[petite]] with [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]]. She wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[sailor hat]], [[glasses]], [[sailor uniform]], [[one-piece swimsuit]], [[pleated skirt]], [[thighhighs]], and [[high heel boots]]. Usually depicted [[holding gun|holding]] or having a [[kel-tec ksg]].

Strangely, she declares that she is a "spy" to everyone she meets.

Illustrator: [[Hyulla]] (Default); [[Kim Hyung Tae]] (Blue Ocean)

title: oneiric_shard_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Oneiric Shards are the premium special currency in Honkai: Star Rail.

They can only be obtained through in-game purchases.

Oneiric shards can be converted to Item [[Stellar Jade]] on a one-to-one ratio. They can also be used to purchase special items in the Contract Shop.

title: geinoujin_kakuzuke_check
body:
[tn]lit. "Celebrities Grading Check"[/tn]

A Japanese TV [[game show]].

"Apparently first-class" celebrities challenge several quizzes of distinguishing highest grade things (foods, music, etc.) from poor ones.

As they answer wrong, they get "downgraded" to the following:

* 一流芸能人: First-class celebrities (or A-list; the initial grade)
* 普通芸能人: Ordinary celebrities (or B-list)
* 二流芸能人: Second-class celebrities (or C-list)
* 三流芸能人: Third-class celebrities (or D-list)
* そっくりさん: Look-alikes (The real celebrities can't be this bad! They must be common people who just look like them...) 
* 映す価値なし: Not worth appearing (on TV; they really [i]disappear[/i] by CG processing)

h4. External links

* "Who is the Real Celebrity?｜ABC Program Catalogue":[https://abc-frontier.co.jp/en-program/entertainment/who-is-a-real-celebrity-2024]
other_names: 芸能人格付けチェック

Originally set to release in summer of 2024, on June 16th, 2024, it was announced the game would be delayed until spring of 2025.

title: bracken_(lethal_company)
body:
A humanoid [[entity_(lethal_company)|]] in [[Lethal Company]].

The Bracken will stalk players that it encounters, following them and attempting to sneak up behind them to snap their neck. If noticed by a player, the Bracken will retreat. If looked at for too long however, the Bracken will become aggressive and attack the player, completely disregarding stealth.

Brackens blend into dark rooms, with only its [[white eyes]] being visible through the darkness.

title: liter_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. The leader of [[Mighty Tools (nikke)|]] consisting of her and [[Centi (nikke)|Centi]]. Contrary to her appearance, she has already lived a long life and has a mature personality comparable to an elderly person. At present, no other NIKKE can surpass her when it comes to construction.

She has [[yellow eyes|yellow]] [[brown eyes]], [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[short hair]] and [[small breasts]]. She wears a [[yellow bodysuit]], a [[yellow helmet|yellow]] [[hard hat]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[brown jacket]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[safety boots]], an [[utility belt]] with a [[wrench]], [[hammer]], etc. Usually together with her [[robot dog]] [[volt (nikke)|Volt]].

body:
Character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. She's a part of [[Mighty Tools (nikke)|]] alongside [[Liter (Nikke)|]].

An artisan with incredible strength who puts her heart into everything she does, never failing to get the job done at [[Mighty Tools (nikke)|]]. As Liter's first apprentice, she has great respect for her mentor. She always listens to what Liter says, and studies her techniques in earnest.

title: concord_(game)
body: [b]Concord[/b] was a sci-fi hero shooter developed by Firewalk Studios and published by [[Sony]] for the PS5 and PC on August 23, 2024. Despite eight years of development and a rumoured budget of $200 to $400 million depending on sources, the game was a catastrophic failure on launch, selling only 25,000 copies worldwide and receiving mixed to negative reviews. It was shut down only two weeks later.

title: contrast_collar
body: When the collar of a shirt or other garment differs in color from that of the body of the garment. The whole collar needs to be a different color, fabric or pattern. Do not use when only the frills on the collar are different. For dress shirts the collar is usually white with matching cuffs. This is then called a Winchester shirt. [[Sailor collar]]s are almost always contrasting in color, thus tagging dress shirts, dresses and other garments is more useful.

title: mitty_(made_in_abyss)
body:
[b]Mitty[/b] is a character from [[Made in Abyss]], voiced by [[Kitamura Eri]].

Mitty is an amorphous [[creature]] that lives with [[Nanachi (made_in_abyss)|]] in The Abyss. Mitty's body is covered in pink fur; has two cat-like ears protruding from her head and claws on the end of her arms; her mouth is split upwards and she is missing her left eye. [spoilers]She was originally a human.[/spoilers]

h4. See also

* [[Mitty (human) (made in abyss)|]]
* [[Mitty (furry) (made in abyss)|]]

title: gold_ship_(racehorse)
body:
[[Real Life]] [[Japan]]ese [[horse|Racehorse]]. Namesake and model of the [[Umamusume]] character [[Gold Ship (Umamusume)|]].

As a gray horse, he was born a chestnut before turning gray. In his racing prime, he was a dapple gray with a wide blaze marking with a distinctive forking snip, a stocking on his right back leg and a coronet on his left back leg. With age, he now has an almost fully white coat, with only the markings being whiter. He commonly ran with a black hood emblazoned with his name, usually without the ear covers, wearing blinkers and a shadow roll.

Gold Ship became infamous for its unpredictable temperament and wildly inconsistent performances, as well as being popular after retirement for being somewhat of a goof. Nevertheless, it had a greatly successful career, with over ¥1b in total earnings.

h4. See Also
* [[Just A Way (racehorse)|]] - Stablemate and best friend
* [[Sugai Naosuke]] - Golshi's trainer and arch nemesis (?)
* [[Imanami Takatoshi]] - Golshi's groom
* [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]] - Sire
* [[Point Flag (racehorse)|]] - Dam
* [[Mejiro McQueen (racehorse)|]] - Damsire
* [[Uberleben (racehorse)|]] - Golshi's daughter and most successful progeny
* [[Meiner Grand (racehorse)|]] - Golshi's most successful son to date
* [[Aoraki (racehorse)|]] - Golshi's son and a white hair
* [[Fenomeno (racehorse)|]] - Rival
* [[Gentildonna (racehorse)|]] - Rival

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Gold Ship":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gold_Ship]
* "Netkeiba: Gold Ship":[https://en.netkeiba.com/db/horse/2009102739/]
* "JBIS-Search: Gold Ship":[https://www.jbis.jp/horse/0001104811/]

title: waddle_doo
body:
A common enemy in the [i][[Kirby (series)|]][/i] games. They look like [[Waddle Dee]]s, but the face is replaced with a [[one-eyed|single eye]] and have two strands of hair that can look like antennae. 

Waddle Doos simply walk around like their brethren, but will sometimes attack with a beam whip. This naturally gives [[Kirby]] the [[Beam Kirby|Beam]] [[copy ability|ability]] upon inhaling them.

title: hakos_baelz_(casual)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English]]'s [[Hakos Baelz]].

It consists of a  [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[white jacket]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] worn with a black [[crop top]] underneath, [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts|shorts]]/ [[detached pants]] with a [[hip vent]], a gold [[belly chain]], [[multiple belts]] with a [[belt pouch]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet thighhigh]] and white [[sneakers]]. She also has an [[arm tattoo]] that is a reference to [[holoCouncil|CouncilRyS]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume, both decorated with [[too many hair ornaments|multiple hairclips]]:
* [[Long hair|Long]] asymetrical hair done in a [[two side up]]
* Long hair tied in a [[side ponytail]].

Just like with her default, her top is portrayed very inconsistently, while it's officially meant to be an [[off-shoulder shirt]] with a [[single sleeve]], more often than not it's portrayed as a [[tube top]] with a [[single detached sleeve]], so please only tag it as an [[off-shoulder shirt]] if you can see the neckline and the sleeve is visibly attached and [[tube top]] if the sleeve is clearly detached.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6230829: Profile
* !post #8381429: Merchandise
other_names: ハコス・ベールズ(私服衣装)
ハコス・ベールズ(私服)

title: hakos_baelz_(steel_rose)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English]]'s [[Hakos Baelz]], "officially":[https://twitter.com/yayoiken1324/status/1790300131121872931] known as the "Steel Rose" costume (after Bae's self-adopted [[chuunibyou]] tag, [i]A steel rose trapped in a cage of ice[/i]).

It's a military inspired costume, featuring a [[white hat|white]] [[peaked cap]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[frilled shirt]] with [[center frills]] and [[puffy long sleeves|puffy]] [[short over long sleeves]], a [[black bowtie]] on top of a [[grey ascot]], [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[high-waist shorts|high-waist]] [[puffy shorts|puffy]]  [[suspender shorts]], black belt with a [[belt chain]]. For legwear, she wears a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[torn thighhighs|torn]] [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]], a [[thigh strap]], along with a pair of [[asymmetrical footwear|asymmetrical]] [[black footwear|black]] [[fold-over boots|fold-over]] [[platform boots]] (one [[single knee boot|knee-high]] and one [[single thigh boot|thigh-high]]). She also has an optional [[fur-trimmed coat|fur-trimmed]] [[black coat|black]] [[overcoat]] with [[wide sleeves]] and [[aiguillette]]s and a [[flower eyepatch|rose eyepatch]] and a [[mouth mask]] as optional accesories, as well as a pair of [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]]. Additionally she also has several [[heart facial mark|heart]] and [[cross facial mark| cross facial marks]], and [[red lips|red lipsticks]] - both of which can be toggled on and off.

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[short hair|Short]] [[flipped hair]] with [[short hair with long locks|long]] [[sidelocks]]
* [[Very long hair]] tied into [[low twintails]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #7721144: Profile

title: netorase
body:
A fetish involving one of the party of the lovers intentionally  manipulating the situation so that their partner will end up raped by the third party, or just flat out convinces/orders her to have sex with them against their will.

Not to be confused with the similarly worded, "[[Netorare]] (寝取られ, also NTR)."

If both parties consent to have the third party involved, use [[swinging (relationship)]] instead. If the party who is having sexual relationship with the third party consent without their partner's acknowledgement, uses [[cheating (relationship)]] instead.

title: elena_(street_fighter)
body:
A character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. She first appeared in [[Street Fighter III (series)|Street Fighter III]] and is voiced by Fujino Hotaru in New Generation and [[street_fighter_iii_(series)|2nd Impact]], Midori Mie in [[street_fighter_iii_(series)|3rd Strike]], and [[Fujita Saki]] in [[Street Fighter X Tekken]]. She is currently the [[tall female|second tallest female character in the series, standing at 183 cm]], she has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and wears a [[white bikini]].

Elena is a tribal princess from [[Kenya]] who have decided to study aboard to learn more about the world and people. Her extroverted, cheerful, and oftentimes naive personality often backfires her attempt to befriending others. She uses [[capoeira]] as her fighting style.
other_names: エレナ(ストリートファイター)

title: fairy_tone
body:
Eight gem-like fairies used by the [[suite_precure|Suite PreCure]] heroines to either transform or perform special attacks. Seven can be summoned by [[hummy_(suite_precure)|Hummy]], while the eighth one accompanies [[cure_muse_(yellow)|Cure Muse]]. Each of the Fairy Tone's names (excluding [[crescendo_tone|Crescendo Tone]]) are based on the Solfège scale (Do, Re, Mi, Fa, So, La, Ti).

* [[dory|Dory]] (ドリー) - Pink in color. Allows [[houjou_hibiki|Hibiki]] to transform into [[Cure Melody]]. When played in a Cure Module, it allows its user to have sweet dreams.
* [[rery|Rery]] (レリー) - White in color. Allows [[minamino_kanade|Kanade]] to transform into [[Cure Rhythm]]. When played in a Cure Module, it renews its user's willpower.
* [[miry|Miry]] (ミリー) - Orange in color. Allows [[cure_melody|Cure Melody]] to summon her Miracle Belltier.
* [[fary|Fary]] (ファリー) - Yellow in color. Allows [[cure_rhythm|Cure Rhythm]] to summon her Fantastic Belltier.
* [[sory|Sory]] (ソリー) - Green in color. Allows [[cure_beat|Cure Beat]] to summon her Love Guitar Rod. When played in a Cure Module, it powers up the Pretty Cures.
* [[lary|Lary]] (ラリー) - Aqua in color. Allows [[Seiren (suite precure)|]]/[[Kurokawa Eren|Eren]] to transform into [[Cure Beat]].
* [[tiry|Tiry]] (シリー) - Blue in color. Only allow [[Cure Muse_(yellow)|]] to attack, but no weapon usable.
* [[dodory|Dodory]] (ドドリー) - Purple in color. Allows [[shirabe_ako|Ako]] to transform into [[cure_muse_(yellow)|Cure Muse]]. Its origin is still unknown.
* [[crescendo_tone|Crescendo Tone]] (クレッシェンドトーン) - A large gold "Fairy of Sounds" responsible for creating all sounds in the world and the other Fairy Tones, who resides in the mystical Healing Chest.

title: brush_holder
body:
A brush holder is a traditional tool used in calligraphy to hold brushes when they are not in use. It is typically designed to keep the brush upright, preserving its bristles and preventing damage. Brush holders come in various shapes, materials, and designs, depending on the culture and era they are from.

In Japan they may be called "fude kake", whereas in China they may be called "bi gua". These terms loosely translate to "hanging brush", as these holders have the brush suspended upside-down.

title: beretta_92
body:
A series of 9×19mm [b][[handgun]][/b] designed and manufactured by Fabbrica d'Armi Pietro Beretta of Brescia, Italy in 1975. It can be recognized by the large slide cutout exposing much of the barrel and the slide-mounted safety/decocking lever (the original model had a frame-mounted safety). Use this tag for all Beretta 92-pattern [[weapon]]s, like the Taurus PT-92 (Brazil), ATI AT92C, PAMAS G1 (France), Beretta 96 (USA) .40 S&W version), etc.

h4. See also

title: special_air_service
body:
[quote][i]"Who Dares Wins”[/i] - Official motto[/quote]

The [[united kingdom|British]] [[military operator|special forces]] service, the most elite branch of the British Army itself known as the Regiment. Well known for the [[1980 Iranian embassy siege]], where they eliminated 5 kidnappers and rescued all but one of the hostages.

It was created during [[World War II]]. The name "Special Air Service" was meant to deceive the [[Nazi]] intelligence agencies into thinking it was a division of the [[royal air force|RAF]].

h1. See also
* [[British Army]]
* [[Royal Navy]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Special Air Service":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_Air_Service

title: fast_helmet
body:
The [b]Ops-Core Future Assault Shell Technology (FAST) Helmet[/b], also known as the [b]FAST helmet[/b] is an American tactical helmet usually worn by Elite Special Forces operators and even by Regular infantry in both Armies and Marine Corps as well as Police forces (particularly SWAT units) in different nations across the world.

The FAST helmet series is characteristic for its shell shape – ear cut geometry which extends critical coverage over the rear occipital bone without load carrier interference, and optimizes weight distribution for increased stability, integration, balance, and improved comfort.

title: jormungandr_(norse_mythology)
body: Jörmungandr also known as the Midgard Serpent or World Serpent, is an unfathomably large and monstrous sea serpent or worm who dwells in the world sea, encircling the Earth and biting its own tail, an example of an ouroboros. As a result of his surrounding Midgard, the beast is referred to as the World Serpent. Jörmungandr releasing his tail is one of the signs of the beginning of Ragnarök.

title: love_deluxe
body:
The [[stand (jojo)|Stand]] of [[yamagishi_yukako|Yukako Yamagishi]] that lets her hair become [[prehensile_hair|prehensile]], extend to great lengths, makes it very durable, strong and so on.

Overuse of the Stand and/or excessive destruction of the hair generated by the Stand lets her hair turn white for a short period of time.

The likely namesake is [i]Love Deluxe[/i], the fourth studio album by the English group Sade (active since 1982), released on 26 October 1992 in the United States and on 1 November 1992 in the United Kingdom.

For the purposes of tagging, only use this tag if Yukako's hair is shown to be prehensile or much longer than is normal for her.

title: luetzow_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Imperial German battlecruiser SMS [i]Lützow[/i].
[tn]Not to be confused with the much later Kriegsmarine heavy cruiser [i]Lützow[/i], who was sold to the Soviets as [[Tallinn (Azur Lane)|]]. Or [[Deutschland (azur lane)|]], who were later renamed into [i]Lützow[/i] following the sale of Tallinn.[/tn]

Note: Standard convention for "ü" is to write it as "ue" when ü is unavailable or inconvenient. For usability reasons Danbooru does not use 'accented' letters in tags.

In-game, she has partially [[braid]]ed [[long hair|long]] [[platinum blonde hair]] and grayish-purple eyes. Her outfit consists of a buttoned [[white shirt]] with [[breast pocket|breast pockets]], a black [[belt]] around a [[black skirt]], [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[mini hat]].

Her rig is the standard Ironblood animalistic style, with her 30.5 cm twin gun mounts placed on either side.

title: maestrale_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Maestrale[/i] (lit. Mistral) in [[Azur Lane]]. 
Character design by [[Byulzzi]], voiced by Eino Airi.

In-game, she sports [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair]] (mostly [[white hair|white]] with red inner hair) and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white dress]], [[green jacket]], [[red armband]] with the [[Sardegna Empire (emblem)|]] emblem printed on it, and a black [[beret]] and a [[black ribbon]].

Her rig consists of two 120 mm twin gun mounts and two 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], one gun and torpedo mount on each side. The bridge superstructure is mounted to her back and connects the two sides.

title: leander_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)
body:
In [[Leander (azur lane)|]]'s [[retrofit (azur lane)|]], her black shirt is swapped for a white shirt, and her old white shirt over-layer is replaced with a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]]. Her wrist cuffs are replaced in favor of [[fingerless gloves]] that extend to just below her elbow, and have similar plaid trim to her skirt and sleeves. She gains a [[purple hairband]] and a [[purple bow]] as a bowtie. She now has anchors where the garter straps meet her thighhighs.

Her rigging maintains a mostly similar design, with the half hulls being more emptied out and thin, extending off of mechanical arms, as opposed to directly attached to the back.

title: leander_(azur_lane)
body:
Lead ship of the Royal Navy Leander-class light cruisers, HMS [i]Leander[/i], [[Azur Lane]].

Leander has [[blue eyes]] and [[platinum blonde hair|platinum blonde]] [[long hair]]. She wears a [[black_shirt|black]] [[collared shirt]] with an open [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] on top, and a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[high-waist skirt]]. Her waistband and shirt cuffs have [[plaid trim]], and a [[white ribbon]] with miniature [[anchor|anchors]] is tied under her shirt collar. She has [[wrist cuffs]] that are extended where the button binds. Below the waist, she has [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and brown [[loafers]].

Her [[rigging]] is a split hull design with 4 twin-[[ship turret|turrets]] and 2 quad-[[torpedo tubes]]. Two of her turrets are mounted directly onto the hulls, with the third being attached via a mechanical arm and the fourth being handheld. On her back is a [[smokestack]].

title: goose
body:
A large waterfowl in the Anatidae family.

A gander is a male goose. Young birds are called goslings. A group of geese on the ground is a gaggle; when in flight, they are called a skein, team, or wedge; when flying close together, they are called a plump.

Geese are larger than [[duck]]s and smaller than most [[swan]]s.

title: langley_(azur_lane)
body:
First Eagle Union (light) carrier, USS [i]Langley[/i] (CV-1), in [[Azur Lane]].

h5. Base Art

Langley has [[long hair|long]], [[wavy_hair|wavy]], mint-[[green hair]] with a [[single side bun]] on her left side and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a [[dress shirt]], a [[blue bow|blue]] [[bowtie]], a yellow [[vest]], a black [[pencil skirt]], and [[black pantyhose]]. She has a [[lab coat]] with an [[American flag print]] lining the inside, [[star print|stars]] on her right and [[striped|stripes]] on her left. She has [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]] with a [[rudder_footwear|rudder heel]]. She also wears oval [[glasses]] and wields a [[riding crop]].

Her [[rigging]] is her ship model split into her bow on her left, and her stern on her right. The hulls are painted white, and each have a brown [[flight deck]] with white markings.

h5. Retrofit Art

After her [[retrofit (azur lane)|retrofit]], she swaps out the dress shirt and vest combo for a [[sleeveless]] dress shirt with [[cleavage_cutout|cleavage]] and [[navel_cutout|navel cutouts]]. She also swaps the labcoat for a shoulderless [[black coat]] with alternating strips of starts and stripes. Her glasses are now rectangular as opposed to oval.

Her rigging now adopts a steel grey and black colorscheme. A notable difference is the bow-half is missing part of it's flight deck, a nod to her real life refit to a sea plane tender. Another difference is the bow and stern sections switched sides, with the bow on her right, and stern on her left.

In game, Langley is a teacher, often scolding the commander and bemoaning being treated like child due to her small stature (a nod to how small the ship was). Both her personality and her skill "First-Generation Carrier," which boosts carrier exp gain, are likely a nod to her role as the first USN carrier, allowing for early training of pilots.

Her plane loadout is entirely fighters, allowing her an incredible amount of air control/anti-plane ability for her rarity/oil cost.

h4. Skins

* !post #2947253: [[langley_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)|Retrofit]]

title: wb_102
body:
Where the Federation Space Force is concerned, all mobile suits are marked according to their mothership. Katoki (and the Master Archive book) uses two-letter abbreviations, such as "WB" for White Base, "AL" for Albion, "MR" for Mariana, etc. The recent MSV-R series tends to use hull numbers instead - SBB-17 for the GM Cannons stationed aboard the Luzal, SVC-71 for the GM Intercept Customs assigned to the White Base II - but it's the same concept. That's a small enough group that they only need a couple of numbers to tell the mobile suits apart, and when they're using three digits, the first one is typically the team number and the second is normally zero.

Thus, Katoki's interpretation of the [b]RX-78 Gundam is marked "WB 102"[/b] because it's the second machine of the White Base's one and only mobile suit team. The machines of South Burning's "Immortal 4th Team" are labeled "LV 401" through "LV 404", which might mean their mothership carries multiple teams, or perhaps that it operates as part of a larger squadron where they need to be able to distinguish the teams...

title: lethe_(fire_emblem)
body:
Playable Laguz unit in [i][[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]][/i] and [i][[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]][/i].

She is a Cat Laguz of the Gallian Beast tribe. She is the older twin sister of [[lyre (fire emblem)|Lyre]]. She's a prideful, proud, and decorated commander.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair|orange hair]] as well as [[purple eyes]].

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Cat

title: lyre_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Lyre[/b] (リィレ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]].

She is a Cat Laguz of the Gallian Beast tribe. She is the younger twin sister of [[lethe (fire emblem)|Lethe]] and possibly has feelings for Commander [[ranulf (fire emblem)|Ranulf]]. She hates fighting but joins the army to be with [[lethe (fire emblem)|Lethe]] and [[ranulf (fire emblem)|Ranulf]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair|orange hair]] often kept in a [[braid|braid]] as well as [[purple eyes]].

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Cat

title: a-chan_(1st_costume)_(hololive)

title: tokino_sora_(1st_costume)
body:
The current default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Tokino Sora]]. It has been her default appearance since May 2018.

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[cropped shirt]], a [[blue vest|blue]] [[cropped vest]], a [[red bowtie]] or a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[wrist cuffs]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], a white [[waist cape]] with a [[rabbit tail|bunny]] [[fake tail|tail]], [[blue thighhighs]], a [[blue ribbon]] [[thigh ribbon|around her left thigh]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[winged footwear|winged]] [[ankle boots|ankle]] [[fold-over boots]] with [[high heel boots|high heel]]s. While her model would receive further updates after to improve its quality, her base costume would be iterated upon with its update for her 3rd Anniversary in 2020, with the additions to it being used to this day.

She has a more elaborate variation of her main costume, which was introduced for her first album [i]Dreaming![/i]. Her costume remains mostly the same but is generally more ornamented, with the addition of [[gold trim]] and an [[aiguillette]] on her vest, [[frills]] on her [[frilled cuffs|cuffs]],  [[gold chain]]s on her waistcape, and [[lace trim]] on her [[lace-trimmed skirt|skirt]]. Additionally she wears a short [[underbust]] [[corset]] and [[bracelet]]s with this costume.

For her original design and its variations, see [[Tokino Sora (old design)]].

h4. Appearance

title: ellie_sattler_(jurassic_park)
body: Dr. Ellie Sattler is a fictional character in the [[Jurassic Park]] franchise. She is introduced in Michael Crichton's 1990 novel Jurassic Park, which began the franchise. [[Steven Spielberg]] directed the 1993 film adaptation, casting Laura Dern as Sattler and giving the character a more substantial role compared to the novel. She is a paleobotanist in both the novel and its film adaptation. In the novel, she is a student of Dr. [[Alan Grant]]. For the film, Spielberg made them a romantic couple, with Sam Neill portraying Grant.

title: lamia
body:
A [[monster girl]] whose upper body is human and whose lower body is [[snake]]-like. Lamia and naga are often rendered so similarly as to make it merely a matter of style which one a serpent-legged character will be called.

The term "naga":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nāga comes from Hinduism and Buddhism, and literally means "cobra". Naga can appear with varying degrees of humanity, but typically have fully human torsos. The term "lamia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamia comes from Greek, though its original usage did not possess snake-like qualities. It was only in the 1600s that "Robert Burton":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Burton_(scholar) ascribed the familiar qualities, which were subsequently popularized by "John Keats":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Keats in his poem "lamia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamia_(poem), published in July 1820.

The Japanese, apparently not having either of these myths as a major part of their tradition, tend to ascribe lamia/naga with personalities like those they associate with snakes in general and lamia are often the tsundere types.

h4. Notable Lamias

* !post #7278069: [[Alipheese Fateburn XVI]] from [i][[Mon-Musu Quest!]][/i]
* !post #6563514: [[Cassiopeia (league Of Legends)|]] from [i][[League of Legends]][/i]
* !post #98488: [[Deis]] from [i][[Breath of Fire]][/i]
* !post #2795203: [[Echidna (Granblue Fantasy)|]] from [i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i]
* !post #2258939: [[Echidna (P&D)|]] from [i][[Puzzle & Dragons]][/i]
* !post #7051802: [[Jashin-chan]] from [i][[Jashin-chan Dropkick]][/i]
* !post #2376255: [[Kiyohime (fate)|Kiyohime]] from [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i]
* !post #620989: [[Lamia Hygieia]] from [i][[Mamonomusume to no Seikatsu]][/i]
* !post #5298315: [[Miia (Monster Musume)|]] from [i][[Monster Musume no Iru Nichijou]][/i]
* !post #4020458: [[Saphentite Neikes]] from [i][[Monster Musume no Oisha-san]][/i]

h4. See also

* [[snake hair]]
* [[lamia boy]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: iriam
body:
A company that hosts a livestreaming platform of the same name, made specifically for [[virtual YouTuber]]s, referred to as 'virtual livers' when they're on the platform.

IRIAM also has a large number of official VTubers in addition to those from other origins.

They later created [[i-Live]], a production that manages their official livers.

IRIAM launched an English version on November 15, 2024 as a United States-only beta release, and there are plans to expand to other countries.

h4. See also

* [[Miria (iriam)|]] - Official image character
* [[Shirasu (Iriam)|]]

title: sage_(dq3)
body:
A character class in [[Dragon Quest III]]. The Sage has the combined magical abilities of the [[Priest (dq3)|]] and [[Mage (dq3)|]], and is the only class that cannot be used at the start of the game. The only way to get a Sage is to change one of the other classes into one at the Alltrades Abbey found partway through the game. Most classes need Words of Enlightment to become a Sage, but the otherwise useless [[Gadabout (dq3)|]] can become a Sage without one.

The female Sage wears a short white dress and a blue cape, while the male wears a sleeveless blue robe. Both versions carry a wooden staff and wear a circlet, and have long blue hair. However, in the HD-2D remake of III, players can now customize the appearance of characters like the Sage.

h4. Official art
* !post #8485358
* !post #8467140

title: selen_tatsuki
body:
A former [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], part of the second wave [[Obsydia (nijisanji)|]] and designed by [[Kamameshi Gougoumaru]]. She was canonically the sister of [[Elira Pendora]] from the first wave [[LazuLight]]. 

She was terminated on February 5th, 2024 following a month-long hiatus, which later sparked a massive controversy regarding Nijisanji's treatment of their talent after the reason behind her hiatus came to light.

Selen has [[medium hair|medium]] [[purple hair]] in [[twin braids]] with [[hairclip|hairclips]] and [[ahoge]], [[heterochromia]] [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[purple eyes]], and [[pointy ears]] that are usually obscured by her [[purple wings|purple]] [[head wings]]. 

h4. Costumes

title: female_builder_(dqb2)
body:
The female main character of [[Dragon Quest Builders 2]] with a love of building structures and systems. She is popularly referred to as [b]Crea[/b] or [b]Kurie[/b] by fans. Additionally, some English-speaking fans refer to her as [b]Creatrix[/b] due to photos from the game tutorials using that name for her.

While the player is able to customize the main character, the Female Builder is typically portrayed with [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and with [[red ribbon]]s in her hair.

According to pre-release material, she is the descendant of either the [[male builder (dqb)|male]] or [[female builder (dqb)|female]] player character from [i][[Dragon Quest Builders]][/i].

h4. Official art
* !post #8644228
* !post #8634498

title: male_builder_(dqb2)
body:
The male co-protagonist of [[Dragon Quest Builders 2]]. He is popularly referred to by fans as [b]Birudo[/b] or [b]Buildrick[/b]. While his default design has [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], the game's customization features enable players to change these aspects alongside hairstyles and clothing. According to pre-release material, he is the descendant of either the [[male builder (dqb)|male]] or [[female builder (dqb)|female]] player character from [i][[Dragon Quest Builders]][/i].

h4. Official art
* !post #8644236
* !post #8634498

title: jessica_albert
body:
One of the protagonists of [i][[Dragon Quest VIII]][/i] and the game's only playable female character, Jessica is a noblewoman who joins the party to avenge her brother [[Alistair Albert|Alistair's]] murder.  At first she is lacking in social niceties, coming off as bossy and pushy, but she eventually softens and becomes one of the [[Hero (dq8)|]]'s most important friends.

She is well-known for wearing a low-cut [[off-shoulder shirt]] that highlights her [[large breasts]], and even uses her sex appeal in combat to distract enemies.

Jessica also appears in [[Itadaki Street]], a [[Monopoly]]-style game for the [[Wii]] featuring characters from the [i]Dragon Quest[/i] and [i][[Mario (series)|]][/i] series.

h4. Official art
* !post #8503528

h4. External links:

* "Dragon Quest Wiki: Jessica Albert":http://dragon-quest.org/wiki/Jessica_Albert

title: hambrabi
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RX-139 Hambrabi[/b]

A well armed, fast and nimble (but light armored) transformable [[mobile suit]] fielded by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] that is designed mostly for [[close-quarters combat|close combat]] and aero[[space]] assaults. It possesses beam weapons and  a total of five monoeye sensors all over it, which enable for great tracking of targets.  

The type's most famous pilot was [[Yazan Gable]]. [spoiler]Yazan's unit was destroyed by an enraged [[Kamille Bidan]] in his [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]], but he survived its destruction inside an escape pod.[/spoiler]

It consists of a [[black choker]], a [[white bikini|white]] [[cross-laced bikini|cross-laced]] [[frilled bikini|frilled]] [[front-tie bikini top]] with [[frilled straps]] with an [[off-shoulder shirt|off-shoulder]] [[see-through shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] on top, a [[black skirt|black]] [[bikini skirt]] and [[sandals]], she also has an optional [[two-tone jacket|two-tone]] [[pink jacket|pink]] and [[white jacket]] with [[sleeves past fingers]] and a [[high collar]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume she has her [[medium hair]] done in [[double bun]]s with an [[ahoge]] and [[sidelocks]] decorated with multiple [[hairclip]]s and [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[center-flap bangs]], the streaks on her hair are much more noticeable than with previous costumes.

title: darjeeling_(girls_und_panzer)
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Tank commander of a [[Churchill (Tank)|]], and overall leader of the "St. Gloriana":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

Her nickname is based on Darjeeling tea "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

Her real name is unknown.

Her [[catchphrase]] is こんな言葉をしってる？(Konna kotoba wo shitteru?, [tn]Do you know this saying?[/tn]).

Voiced by [[Kitamura Eri]] "[2]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h5. St. Gloriana Girls College

h6. Original Anime

A senior from St. Gloriana Girls College. She is a tank commander. As the commanding officer at St. Gloriana, she leads the entire Panzer team. Her characteristic is the way she speaks in a high-handed manner.

title: lingsha_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character. 

The new Cauldron Master of the Xianzhou Luofu's Alchemy Commission following the Ambrosial Arbor Crisis. Voiced by [[Maeda Kaori]] in Japanese. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[red eyes]], [[pointy ears]], [[colored extremities|red-colored skin]] on the arms and legs, and [[medium breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] black [[crop top]] held by a white [[criss-cross halter]], white [[wrist cuffs]], [[black skirt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8651700: Splash art

h4. Profile
[expand]
"I am a Vidyadhara, born and raised on the Luofu, and I once studied the healing arts under the name of 'Dan Zhu.' But my master became bogged down in politics and was banished to a place far from home. I followed her there. Now that I've changed my name and come home, many complicated feelings have returned."

The new Cauldron Master of the Xianzhou Luofu's Alchemy Commission. An intelligent and quick-witted Vidyadhara healer. She has a sharp sense of smell and often uses this to diagnose illnesses, as well as utilizing incense to calm the minds of others.

She is adept at dealing with complicated social relationships. Though she might be fuming inside, her expression would remain calm and serene.
[/expand]

h4. See also

* [[Nuwa (Honkai Impact)|]] - Her [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.
* [[Fuyuan (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] - Her "incense beast" companion.

title: forehead_protector
body:
A piece of protective gear for the forehead. May be in the form of a metal plate attached to a cloth [[headband]] (as in [i][[Naruto]][/i], where most ninja wear such headgear with their village's [[Tag Group:Symbols|symbol]] engraved on it), an entirely metal headband or even a metal piece on the forehead which seemingly isn't held in place by anything at all (i.e. [[Leona (League of Legends)|Leona]] in [i][[League of Legends]][/i]).

title: manny_pacquiao
body:
Also known as "PacMan", he is a Filipino boxer, businessman, politician, actor, and singer. 

In boxing, he is the only eight-division world champion in its history and has won twelve major world titles. He was also the first boxer to win the lineal championship in four different weight classes, the first boxer to win major world titles in four of the eight "glamour divisions" (flyweight, featherweight, lightweight, and welterweight), and is the only boxer to hold world championships across four decades (1990s, 2000s, 2010s, and 2020s).

title: rear_naked_choke
body:
The rear naked choke (RNC) is a [[choke hold]] in martial arts applied from an opponent's back, which has an optional use of body scissors to further restrain the opponent's movement.

In professional wrestling, the term "rear naked choke" refers to a grounded version of the [[sleeper hold]] with body scissors applied. This variant is used by several wrestlers such as [[All Elite Wrestling]] and [i]Ring of Honor[/i] wrestler [[Samoa Joe]] (calling his RNC as the [i]Coquina Clutch[/i]), [[WWE]] wrestlers [[Gunther (WWE)|]] (as the [i]Gojira Clutch[/i]), and Shayna Baszler (as the [i]Kirifuda Clutch[/i]). WWE wrestler Karrion Kross does a modified version of the RNC which he calls as the [i]Kross Jacket[/i].  

In [[Judo]], the rear naked choke is known as Hadaka-jime, one of the 36 constriction techniques of Kodokan Judo

title: otoshidama
body:
A [[gift]] of [[money]] given to children on Japanese [[New Year]]'s Day.

Otoshidama tend to be given in white [[envelope]]s bound with a pink or red paper 'ribbon cord' (in [i]mizuhiki[/i] style). Often this "ribbon cord" may just be a pattern printed on the envelope. Money bills are usually folded in threes before being inserted.

The word "お年玉" (otoshidama) may sometimes be printed on the front of the envelope. This unambiguously identifies this as otoshidama (instead of [[hongbao]]). A less common word is "祝".

h4. Examples

* !post #1595291
* !post #1891823
* !post #2983502
* !post #3218197

h4. See also

* [[New Year]]
* [[hongbao]] [tn]Chinese equivalent. Often red. Almost never white (considered inauspicious).[/tn]

title: oak_cake_roll_(honkai:_star_rail)
body: A consumable in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. In-setting, the food item originated from a nutritional desperation among frontier settlers before evolving into a culinary tradition among the aristocratic classes. As such, the name is literal— elements from actual oak trees and other flora are baked into the cakes, presenting a formidable challenge for diners who order them. Usually associated with [[Firefly (Honkai: Star Rail)|]], who gets one every day in Penacony.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and famously [[large breasts]]. Her typical attire is a [[white tank top|white]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[tank top]] and a [[black skirt]] with [[suspenders]]. The remake adds a [[black shirt|black]] [[undershirt]] and [[black shorts]], as well as [[black thighhighs]] to her typical attire.

title: navy_seals
body:
The [b]United States Navy Sea, Air, and Land (SEAL) Teams[/b], also known as the [b]Navy Seals[/b], is the [[military operator|Special Forces]] of the [[United States Navy]]. 

Since its founding in January 1, 1962, the Navy SEALs have performed various special military operations for the United States military throughout the world.

The group became famous when one of it's Teams, [b]Naval Special Warfare Development Group[/b] (DEVGRU), unofficially known as [b]Seal Team 6[/b], the most elite force of the Navy SEALs, killed Al-Qaeda leader [[Osama bin Laden]] on May 2, 2011.

Unfortunately, due to the Seals new found fame, some former and current members have criticize some of their teammates, especially newer ones, of becoming rude and disrespectful to the chain of command, who are more interested of becoming famous rather than doing their duty and serving their country.

title: hokuto_no_ken
body:
[b]Hokuto no Ken[/b] (known as [b]Fist of the North Star[/b] in the west) is a Japanese [[post-apocalypse|post-apocalyptic]] action manga series and media franchises illustrated by [[Hara Tetsuo]] and written by Buronson. The manga was first published in 1982 on [[Weekly Shounen Jump]].

The original anime adaptation created by [[Toei Animation]] in 1984 sparked a massive controversy due to the anime featured massive amount of violence (especially for its time when "Adult content air time" did not exist), most notably gore. leading to massive usage of censorship on the anime, and the creation of "Adult content air time", a slot of airing time on Television specifically for violent anime.

Nevertheless, the series' extreme violence and masculine-heavy theme had later inspired other action shounen and seinen manga and anime, particularly during late 80s and 90s era. Notable examples were [[jojo_no_kimyou_na_bouken|JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]], [[Grappler Baki]], [[Bastard!!]] [[Sun-Ken Rock]], [[Berserk]] and recently [[Chainsaw Man]] and [[Jujutsu Kaisen]].

Due to the unique [[manly]] artstyle, heavely inspired by 80s Movies like [[Mad Max]] and [[Terminator]], the show is also frequently subjected to various [[parody]] comedy doujins that were usually revolved around turning various cute anime girl into a "[[hara_tetsuo_(style)|K-style]]" style macho women (mostly involves the character [[cosplay]] and attempt to roleplay as their respective character) for comedic effect.

h5. Story (anime adaptation)

Near the end of the 20th century, a nuclear war engulfed most of the Earth's surface, reducing most of the world into a vast desert wasteland. The survivors of mankind banded together in tribes in order to fight over the few supply of uncontaminated food and water still left in the world, with the strong often preying on the weak. [[Kenshiro]], the successor of the assassination art known as Hokuto Shinken, wanders the wasteland after being separated from his fiancee [[Yuria (Hokuto no Ken)|]] by his friend-turned-enemy [[Shin_(hokuto_no_ken)|Shin]]. Accompanied by two young children, [[Bat (Hokuto no Ken)|]] and [[Lin (hokuto no ken)|]], Ken becomes a savior to the weak and innocent from the various gangs and ruthless bandits threatening their survival. Throughout the course of his journey, Kenshiro encounters various formidable rivals and adversaries, ultimately culminating with Kenshiro's eldest adoptive brother [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|]], an oppressive tyrant who challenges Ken for the right of the Hokuto Shinken succession.

Several years afterward, Kenshiro reunites with the now grown Bat and Lynn in order to stand up against a corrupt Imperial Army. The three, with the help of other rebels, manage to expose a conspiracy within the Imperial Army to keep the Heavenly Empress ([spoiler]Lynn's estranged twin sister, Lui[/spoiler]) imprisoned. The Empress is saved, only for Lynn to be taken to the "Land of Asura", a country of warriors where only the mightiest survive. Kenshiro crosses to Asura in pursuit of her, only to find himself fighting against the three generals who rule over the land. [spoiler]Kenshiro finds himself fighting not only against his own blood brother Hyou, but also [[Kaioh (hokuto no ken)|Kaioh]], Raoh's own brother.[/spoiler]

body: [b]Homelander[/b] (real name [b]John Gillman[/b]) is the main antagonist of the comic book series [[The Boys]], and one of the two posthumous overarching antagonists (alongside [[Black Noir]]) of it's sequel/spin-off miniseries The Boys: Dear Becky. He is also the leader of The Seven, one of the strongest Supes in the world, and the archenemy of [[Billy Butcher]], the leader of The Boys. He is essentially a psychopathic [[parody]] of [[Superman]]. He is also notorious for his tendency to spam his [[laser]] [[eye beam]] attacks. h4. title: homelander_power_scaling_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] which originated from a 2024 Twitter debate about whether [[Homelander]] from [[The Boys]] or [[Sportacus]] from [[LazyTown]] was stronger.

After many pointed out that Sportacus was capable of numerous superhuman feats that far surpassed Homelander, the meme later evolved into a powerscaling fanart trend that involves pitting Homelander against Sportacus or other characters in a typically one-sided fight.

body:
One of the most famous scenes in the [[Gachimuchi]] universe, which originally came from gay porn series "Lords of the Lockeroom" (the origin of the Gachimuchi universe).

In this scene, [[Van Darkholme]] walked into the [[locker room]] to change his outfit from his [[BDSM|leather]] outfit to exercise. [[Mark Wolff]], who was sitting on a [[bench]], mocked Van's leather outfit by saying "Hey buddy, I think you got the wrong door, the Leather club is two blocks down". Van  instantly replied "Fuck you", prompting Wolff to challenge Van to do gay pants wrestling and Van accepted his challenge.

title: gremlins_(film)
body:
A 1984 American fantasy comedy horror film directed by Joe Dante.

The story follows young man Billy Peltzer, who receives a strange creature as a pet, which then spawns other creatures that transform into aggressive imp-like monsters later known as "[[gremlin (mythology)|]]" that wreak havoc on Billy's town during [[Christmas]] Eve.

The film's depiction of gremlin has since codified the relatively new folklore creature into fantasy worldbuilding.

title: orc_eiyuu_monogatari
body:
Orc Eiyūden Monogatari ~Sontaku Retsuden~ (Orc Hero Story ~Biographical Conjecture~) is a 2019-to-present light novel series by Rifujin na Magonote (author of [[Mushoku Tensei]]).  The series began physical publication in 2020 and features illustrations by [[Asanagi]].  A manga adaption is in the works and the novels are published as Orc Eroica in English.

The series revolves around the [[orc]] hero [[Bash_(orc_eiyuu_monogatari)|]] who has set off on a journey as a representative of his race after the end of the great war between the 12 races. While being a representative of his race is the surface reason for Bash's journey, he has the ulterior motive of using this journey as a means to lose his virginity.

title: card_game
body:
A game played with [[card]]s as the main medium of interaction.

Card games were typically divided in two categories:

* [b]Collectible card game[/b] (CCG), a card game that utilize a fixed set of cards with little to no new cards added into the game, such as the classic [[playing card]]s and [[UNO (game)|]].
* [b]Trading card game [/b] (TCG), derived from [[trading card]]s, a card game that feature a wide variety of cards, with new cards being regularily added into the game. Notable examples including [[Magic: The Gathering]] and [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]]
other_names: トレーディングカードゲーム

title: m.u.g.e.n
body:
A "[[Fighting game]] engine" made by Elecbyte originally intended to be made into a run-and-gun game. When it was abandoned in 1999, modders turned it into an open-source fighting game with official fighting game characters and fanmade versions of many different characters.

Surprisingly, two characters were produced for M.U.G.E.N before its discontinuation: [[Kung Fu Man]] and [[Suave Dude]]. Both of these two characters became the base of the modders to create various new characters. 

After learning about their abandoned project being revived, Elecbyte briefly returned in September of 2009 with a new HD version of MUGEN available for download on its site.

This tag can be applied to various [[original]] M.U.G.E.N characters, either a completely original design or an [[alternate costume]] of an existing character.

title: helena_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the USS [i]Helena[/i] (CL-50). Character design by [[Realmbw]], voiced by Chuujou Tomoyo.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with a [[purple hair|purple]] inner shade and [[ahoge]], and [[purple eyes]]. As she was the only of the [i]Brooklyn[/i]-class that failed to survive the war, she has a shorter height than her sisters. 

Her outfit is the same as her sisters: a [[two-tone dress]] of white and Navy Blue with [[side slit|side openings]], black [[elbow gloves]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], [[black panties]], and [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her five historic 152 mm triple mounts in two separate hull pieces, one of which is used as a handgun. Her SG [[radar]] is visible as a [[hair ornament]], a reference to how she had historically been the first to detect inbound Japanese forces in the battles of Cape Esperance and Naval Guadalcanal and likewise reflects in her in-game skills. She also has a 28 mm quad [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount directly to her back.

She was torpedoed at the attack on Pearl Harbor in December 1941 and was repaired and modernized before returning to service in early 1942. She was sunk in the Battle of Kula Gulf on 6 July 1943.
