title: 2024_south_korea_martial_law_crisis
body:
On the night of 3 December, 2024, [[South Korea]]n president [[Yoon Suk-Yeol]] declared martial law to suspend the country's parliament. In his declaration, Yoon accused the opposition coalition, which has the majority in the National Assembly, of being involved in "anti-state activities".

In the ensuing events, the opposition coalition MPs voted to force the president to lift the martial law, and protests ensued to pressure Yoon to lift the martial law. After just 6 hours, president Yoon lifted the martial law after pressure from the South Korean public.

The event was generally described as a self-coup, as Yoon's approval ratings had significantly dropped before the event, along with facing various scandals. Yoon was later impeached on 14 December that year.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: 2024 South Korean martial law crisis":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_South_Korean_martial_law_crisis]

title: takarabune
body:
In [[japanese mythology|Japanese folklore]], the [b]Takarabune[/b] (宝船), or "Treasure Ship", is a mythical ship piloted through the heavens by the [[Seven Lucky Gods]] during the first three days of the [[New Year]]. A picture of the ship forms an essential part of traditional Japanese New Year celebrations.

(From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia)

title: ze_(phrase)
body:
ぜ

A particle in the Japanese language which adds emphasis and masculinity to a sentence.

It is frequently associated with [[Kirisame Marisa]], who commonly ends her sentences with ze, even when it doesn't make much grammatical sense.

This tag should [b]not[/b] be used any time the ze particle appears in a sentence. It should only be used when it is given some form of emphasis, such as when a speech bubble contains nothing but the word ze, or the word is written in romaji in the original text.

This tag replaces pool #1431: Touhou - Kirisame Marisa - ZE!

title: ford_crown_victoria
body: A full-sized sedan manufactured by the [[Ford|Ford Motor Company]], the Crown Victoria was best known as the iconic [[police car]] (and [[taxi]]) for several decades. Built on Ford's Panther platform, shared with the [[Lincoln Town Car]] and Mercury Grand Marquis. Production of the entire line completely ceased in 2012 (with the Crown Victoria Police Interceptor having already been discontinued in 2011). Cars that replaced the Crown Vic in police fleets vary by city, some common replacements being the [[Dodge Charger]], [[Ford Taurus]], and [[Chevrolet Caprice]]. h4. title: sengoku_jidai
body:
A period of feudal [[Japan]] between around circa 1450 to 1600 in which the country was divided among various clans of warlords who fought for dominance over the others, following the decline of the Ashikaga Shogunate at the end of the [[Nanboku-chou Jidai]].

The period reached its climax around 1540 when the "three great unifiers" of Japan emerged; [[Oda Nobunaga]] who managed to unify Japan by force before being forced to commit suicide after being betrayed by [[Akechi Mitsuhide]], [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi]], Nobunaga's retainer who revenged his master by killing Mitsuhide and unify Japan, before faced his downfall after a failed invasion of Korea in 1598, and [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]], another of the Nobunaga's retainer who waited for an opportunity and seized all of remnants of Toyotomi and Oda clans and finally unified the country after the [[battle of Sekigahara]]. 

The era ended with Japan being united under the leadership of the Tokugawa shogunate who closed the country and started the [[Edo Jidai|Edo period]]. Due to being one of the most prevalent era in Japanese history, several media franchises have emerged based on it. It also has influenced various media works in the country.

h4. See also

* [[Samurai]]

title: fk_crvena_zvezda
body:
[B]Fudbalski klub Crvena zvezda[/b] (Football Club Red Star), otherwise colloqually referred to internationally as Red Star Belgrade, is a Serbian professional football club based in Belgrade, and a member of the Red Star multi-sport club. It is the most successful club from Southeastern Europe, and the most popular football club in Serbia. Their eternal rivals are fellow Belgrade football club Partizan, engaged in one of Europe's fiercest derbies.

In Japan, the club is well-known for winning the 1991 Intercontinental Cup, whose final match was played in Tokyo (which in Serbia prompted the slogan 'Srbija do Tokija' [Serbia to Tokyo], due to winning the European Cup that year in Italy as well); its most well-known member in Japan is [[Dragan Stojkovic Piksi|Dragan Stojković "Piksi"]], who signed with [[Nagoya Grampus]] and would later coach for the team after retirement.

h4. External links

* Twitter: "FKツルヴェナ ズヴェズダ":https://twitter.com/crvenazvezda_jp
other_names: レッドスター・ベオグラード

title: genryuusai_maki
body:
[b]Genryuusai Maki[/b], more commonly known simply as [b]Maki[/b], is a character in the [[Final Fight]] and [[Street Fighter]] series, who originally appeared in the [[Super Nintendo]] beat 'em up Final Fight 2 as one of the game's main characters. 

Maki is a blond-haired red-clad female ninja who happens to be the younger sister of Guy's fiancee Rena. Like [[Guy (final fight)|]], Maki is also trained in the Bushin style of ninjutsu and uses many of the same abilities and techniques.

Maki was well received by critics and fans alike, becoming one of the most popular Street Fighter characters despite appearing only in [[Capcom vs SNK 2]] and portable versions of [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Alpha 3]].

title: guy_(final_fight)
body:
[b]Guy[/b] is a video game character in both the [[Final Fight]] and [[Street Fighter]] series by [[Capcom]]. 

He first appeared in the 1989 beat 'em up Final Fight and later appeared in the [i]Street Fighter Alpha[/i] series. 

Guy is a red-clad ninpō master of Japanese descent who has been taught the special Bushin form of [[ninjutsu]].

According to Capcom's original arcade production staff, Guy's original design was based on "Guy Picciotto":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guy_Picciotto , the former vocalist of the late 80s post-hardcore punk rock band "Fugazi":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fugazi . Like his video game counterpart, Picciotto was known for his fondness to wear orange shirts and [[converse]] sneaker shoes during concerts.

h4. See also

* [[Genryuusai Maki]]
other_names: ガイ(ファイナルファイト)

After the [[2011 Tohoku Earthquake and Tsunami]], Twitter user "Semimaru-P":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/%E8%9D%89%E4%B8%B8p called on artists to create [i]namazu-e[/i] (catfish-themed [[ukiyo-e]]) to communicate the message, "Pray for no more earthquakes," or "Let's work together not to give in to the earthquake." title: chinese_zodiac
body:
The Shēngxiào (Chinese: 生肖), better known in English as the Chinese Zodiac, is a scheme that relates each year to an animal and its reputed attributes, which, combined with the 5 Chinese elements (fire, water, earth, wood, metal), creates a 60-year cycle. 

Unlike the Western [[zodiac]], it has no relation to the constellations on the ecliptic.

Many other Asian countries have adopted the Chinese Zodiac as well, sometimes with slight changes ("see below":#dtext-variants).

This tag is automatically applied when the image reference at least one of the Chinese Zodiac, such as various [[New Year]] arts.

[table]
  [thead]
    [tr]
      [th colspan="5" align="center"]The Twelve Zodiacs[/th]
    [/tr]

title: kaga_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Kaga[/i]. Character designed by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]] (original) and [[Iguchi Yuka]] (current). 

A [[kyuubi|nine-tailed]] [[fox_girl|kitsune]], Kaga has [[white hair]] and [[multiple tails|tails]], [[blue eyes]] with red [[eyeshadow]], and [[large breasts]]. She is often wearing a [[fox mask]] as well. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[black kimono]], [[white coat|white]] [[haori]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[hakama skirt]], [[black corset]] with a [[sakuramon]], black [[wristband]]s, [[grey collar]] with a sakuramon, [[white socks|white kneehighs]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of a blue-colored [[flight deck]] with aircraft-shaped [[shikigami]]. 


h4. Skins
h6. Note: The skins of the CV Kaga cannot be shared with [[Kaga (battleship) (azur lane)|BB Kaga]].

body:

title: right-over-left_kimono
body:
A [[kimono]] worn with its right side folded over its left. Traditionally this is how the recently deceased are dressed for burial, consequently it is a major faux pas to wear a kimono this way while alive. Fictional works may sometimes feature [[ghost]]s (or other beings connected to death) wearing them. Occasionally the product of [[artistic error]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6005649

h4. See also

* [[triangular headpiece]]
* [[funeral kimono]]
* [[shiroshouzoku]]

h4. External links

* "Hyakumonogatari Kaidankai: What is the White Kimono Japanese Ghosts Wear?":[https://hyakumonogatari.com/2012/04/04/what-is-the-white-kimono-japanese-ghosts-wear/]

title: toutetsu_yuuma
body: [b] Undefeated Matriarch of the Gouyoku Alliance [/b] Toutetsu Yuuma is the main antagonist and final boss of [[Touhou]] 17.5, [[sunken fossil world|Gouyoku Ibun ~ Suibotsushita Chinshuu Jigoku (Strange Tale of Avarice ~ Submerged Hell of Sunken Sorrow)]], first mentioned in Wily Beast and Weakest Creature. In [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]], she is revealed to have once been friends with [[Yakumo Ran|Ran]]. As her title suggests, she's the boss of the [[Eagle Spirit (touhou)|]]s. She has large [[red horns|red]], [[sheep horns]], with a [[horn ribbon]] on both horns. She has [[curly hair|curly]], [[white hair]], [[red eyes]] with [[horizontal pupils|horizontal]], [[rectangular pupils]], and is often depicted with [[sharp teeth]]. She wears [[earrings]] on her [[pointy ears]]. She wears a [[blue dress]] with [[detached_sleeves|detached]], [[red sleeves]]. Her clothing has a [[meandros]] [[patterned clothing|pattern]] with [[eye print]]s. Some artists may depict her wearing a [[blue vest]] and [[blue skirt]] instead. She often goes [[barefoot]] and [[holding spork|carries around]] an [[oversized object|oversized]] [[spork]] which may be filled with [[motor oil]] or [[blood]]. Her spork may be depicted as a [[spoon]] by some artists, either deliberately or as a mistake. Her ability allows her to devour and absorb almost absolutely anything, turning it into her power. Unlike her fellow Animal Realm matriarchs, she and her organization prefer to avoid pointless conflict, and would rather recruit or forge a mutually-beneficial relationship with their enemies, with an all-out war being a last resort for them. Taking advantage of the events in Wily Beast and Weakest Creature, she went to the Former Hell of Blood Pools in order to monopolize the petroleum deposits there, containing the desires of long dead organic beings. Note: If you can't concretely identify the utensil she is wielding (even with the tags/title/commentary/parent-child posts/pools), just tag [[utensil]] instead. h4. See also * [[Imaginary Toutetsu]] h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Yuuma Toutetsu":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Yuuma_Toutetsu

title: belial_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Hosoya Yoshimasa]].

The fallen angel of cunning plays fast and loose with his tongue, condemning the world at one moment, extolling the sanctity of life the next. Watch him run his fingers down the supple stem of a flower, snap it in twain, and waltz across a stage garnished with skydwellers' viscera. Look into the abyss of his heart, and what does one find? A feeling of insecure narcissism, or is it altruistic benevolence? Belial numbered among the first primal beasts to be brought into existence. Now a fallen angel known as the Serpent, he remains as devoted to his creator, [[lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucilius]], as he was millennia ago. [spoiler]  He instigated the Primarch rebellions as part of Lucilius' schemes. "000" reveals that his loyalties have carried over 2000 years, having used [[lucifer_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|Lucifer]]'s body to revive Lucilius to help the Astral finally witness the end of the world. [/spoiler]

Belial was revealed as a Character Pass Season 1 DLC character in [[Granblue Fantasy Versus]] on December 14, 2019, as part of a villains pack alongside Beelzebub. He was later carried over to [[Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]], along with the other prior DLC characters.

h4.Official Alternate Costumes

body:
[B]Chako[/b] is a female farmer that is encountered early in [[Dragon Quest Builders 2]]. She was renamed to [b]Rosie[/b] in the English localization.

Notably, she bears a resemblance to [[Norimaki Arale]] from [[Dr. Slump]], albeit with [[aqua hair]] instead of purple. This may be intentional, considering that [[Toriyama Akira]] created some (if not all) of the character designs in the game.

title: lucio_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]].

The beautiful young man, surrounded by a divine aura, introduced himself as a "former stage actor" when he appeared before the crew. He is very gentle and dislikes conflicts. However, since he does not understand the subtleties of other people's emotions very well, his heart grieves at the sight of people fighting, especially if it's because of his beautiful face. He has profound knowledge about the bottom of the sky - another world called the "Crimson Horizon". [spoiler]He is the true identity of [[helel_ben_sahar_(granblue_fantasy)|Helel ben Sahar]].[/spoiler]

h4. Profile

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]Age[/td][td]Unknown[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Height[/td][td]Unknown[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Race[/td][td]Unknown[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Hobbies[/td][td]People-watching[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Likes[/td][td]Pure, righteous, and beautiful people; good deeds[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dislikes[/td][td]Snakes, evil people, apples[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4. Official Alternate Costumes
Shares a striking resemblance with the supreme primarch [[lucifer_(Shingeki no Bahamut)|Lucifer]] and the Astral researcher [[Lucilius_(Granblue Fantasy)|Lucilius]]. To avoid any mistaken tagging, you can rely on the following contextual cues: Lucifer is frequently paired with [[Sandalphon_(granblue_fantasy)|Sandalphon]] and features [six pairs of wings](https://gbf.wiki/images/1/1e/Npc_zoom_3990190000_01.png), while Lucio, often seen in his [summer outfit](https://gbf.wiki/images/9/9e/Npc_zoom_3040286000_01.png), has [two pairs of wings](https://gbf.wiki/images/d/d6/Npc_zoom_3040106000_01.png). Lucilius is typically depicted wearing either his [https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/vsbattles/images/8/87/Astral_Researcher.png/revision/latest?cb=20190629090002](astral robes) or his [https://gbf.wiki/images/d/d6/Npc_zoom_3991054000_01.png](Raid Boss) attire.

* !post #7392267: Default
* !post #3869877: [[lucio (summer) (granblue fantasy)|Summer]]

title: lucifer_(shingeki_no_bahamut)
body:
[[Shingeki no Bahamut]] and [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]] in Japanese.

One of the very first primal beasts ever created, he is known as the supreme primarch who commands all other archangels. He was made to oversee evolution by an [[lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)|Astral researcher]] who had a keen interest in the subject. Bequeathed with ultimate power by the Astrals, he strives to protect the people of the Sky Realm. Even now, his eyes—melancholic and unsuited to an ultimate weapon—scan the blue horizon, in search of anything that might disturb the progress of the skies. Originally just a Shingeki no Bahamut collaboration summon, he becomes an important recurring character in the "What Makes the Sky Blue" storyline.

[spoilers]Lucifer is credited as the creator of the archangels [[sandalphon_(granblue_fantasy)|Sandalphon]] and [[raziel_(granblue_fantasy)|Raziel]]. He and [[belial_(granblue_fantasy)|Belial]] were Lucilius' first creations and were created at the same time. In What Makes the Sky Blue II: Paradise Lost, he is decapitated by [[beelzebub_(granblue_fantasy)|Beelzebub]] so that he and Belial can harvest his body and use it to resurrect Lucillius. Overwhelmed with grief and anger, Sandalphon initially struggles with the loss but ultimately resolves to honor Lucifer's legacy. Sandalphon ascends to become the new supreme primarch, taking on the responsibilities and burden of leadership to protect the skies as Lucifer once did.[/spoilers]

Lucifer shares a similar appearance with Lucilius and is identical to [[lucio_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucio]] in both face and clothing, making differentiation challenging. Lucifer wears a short-sleeved [[breastplate]] with [[shoulder armor]], [[elbow gloves]], a thin red cloth around his neck, and a [[white cape]]. Unlike Lucio, who has two small wings, Lucifer has [[multiple_wings|six]] large [[feathered_wings|feathered]] [[white wings]]. Without wings, their personalities offer clues: Lucio appears teasing, while Lucifer is more innocent and joyous. Sandalphon is often annoyed by Lucio but blushes or appears delighted around Lucifer. Most [[yaoi|ship art]] featuring Sandalphon pairs him with Lucifer unless explicitly indicated otherwise.

title: top_gear
body:
A [[BBC (broadcaster)|]] motoring show that became famous not only in Britain but also internationally and includes discussions, races, interviews, car challenges and a variety of other segments. Its most famous period and the inspiration for most works on this site referencing the series are when  [[Jeremy Clarkson]], [[James May]] and [[Richard Hammond]] presented a reworked version of the show from Series 1 in 2002 to Series 22 in 2015. Another well known character from [i]Top Gear[/i] is the  [[The Stig]], played by a number of anonymous race drivers.

The show was briefly cancelled in 2015 after Jeremy Clarkson was fired from the BBC for punching a producer, with Hammond and May leaving soon after. However, due to its popularity, they would be hired by [[Amazon (company)|]] for a new show called [[The Grand Tour]], which followed the same format.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia article: Top Gear (2002 TV series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Top_Gear_(2002_TV_series)]

title: lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]] in Japanese and [[Sean Chiplock]] in English.

Introduced as ??? in the first part of the event "What Makes the Sky Blue", Lucilius is later revealed in the second part to be an Astral and the creator of the first Primal Beasts, Supreme Primarch Lucifer and his adjutant [[Belial_(granblue_fantasy)|Belial]]. 

This Astral was the head researcher of a research lab. His unequivocal genius and transcendent will led to many breakthroughs that would shake up the world—notably the birth of the original primal beasts. But as his research into evolution progressed, he drew his own conclusions about the gods' designs and established the fallen angels to bring about his grand finale—a plan intended to destroy the world. Though rarely moved by emotion, he harbors a centuries-old hatred for the gods, seeing them as tyrants who imposed order on the boundless universe. For him, there is only one state of true freedom—nothingness.

On December 2, 2023, he was revealed as a boss in the story mode of [[Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]] and later joined the playable roster as the first DLC character on January 16, 2024. Later, it was announced on January 11, 2024 that he would appear as an optional post-game boss in [[Granblue Fantasy Relink]], debuting in the game on March 14, 2024.

h4. Profile

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]Age[/td][td]Unknown[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Height[/td][td]175 cm[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Race[/td][td]Astral[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Hobbies[/td][td]Research[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Likes[/td][td]Free will[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dislikes[/td][td]Summer[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4.Official Alternate Costumes
In Granblue Fantasy, Lucilius, [[lucifer_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|Lucifer]], and [[lucio_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucio]] share identical facial features, making them distinguishable only by clothing and context. Lucilius, in his "Raid Boss":https://gbf.wiki/Lucilius_(NPC) form, is characterized by a [[stitched_neck|stitched neck scar]], black metallic curves on his chest and waist, [[topless_male|no shirt]], a [[torn_cape|torn]] [[red cape]], [[asymmetrical arms]], and [[armored_boots|armored]] [[thigh boots]]. In his "Astral Researcher":https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/vsbattles/images/8/87/Astral_Researcher.png/revision/latest?cb=20190629090002 form, he wears an [[oversized_clothes|oversized]] [[white robe]] with a [[hood]], a [[turtleneck]], and occasionally carries a [[holding_staff|staff]]. He typically has a [[expressionless|cold expression]] and is frequently seen with Belial.

* !post #7396494: {{lucilius_(granblue_fantasy) scar|Wings of the Apocalypse}} 
* !post #8526683: {{lucilius_(granblue_fantasy) hood|Astral Researcher}}

title: angelica_(project_moon)
body:
[[Library of Ruina]] character, married to [[Roland (project moon)|]].
Based off of "Angelica":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angelica_(character) from the 15th and 16th century epic poems "Orland Innamorato":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Innamorato and "Orlando Furioso":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Furioso.

She wears a [[black jacket]] with [[black sweater|black]] [[turtleneck sweater]], a [[ring necklace]], [[black pants]], and a pair of [[black gloves]] [Spoiler] which she uses to store her arsenal of weapons and create an area of silence around her, giving her the title of the Black Silence[/spoiler]

[Spoiler][[Angelica (project moon)|]] and her brother [[Argalia (project moon)|]] are both Colour fixers, the Black Silence and Blue Reverberation respectively.
She and her unborn child perished before the game's events to [[The Pianist (project moon)|]], kick-starting the game's entire plot. Her death caused [[Roland (project moon)|]] to inherit her title of the Black Silence and rampage through the city in a vain attempt to get revenge on the one responsible for her death while her brother [[Argalia (project moon)|]] was driven insane by her death and distorted.[/spoiler]

title: joel_(vinesauce)
body:
A Swedish streamer associated with [[Vinesauce]]. Well-known for his fanbase's many bizarre [[meme|memes]] and inside jokes, as well as his Windows Destruction and DOS Madness streams. He is also well-known for being the origin of the [[grand dad|7 Grand Dad]] meme. Also commonly referred to as "Vargskelethor".

title: mega_man_(series)
body:

h4. Games

* [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]]
* [[Mega Man Star Force (series)|]] [tn]([i]Shooting Star Rockman[/i] in Japan)[/tn]

h6. Other Games

* [[Pachislot Rockman Ability]], a pachislot Mega Man game.

h6. Adaptations

h4. See also

* [[MegaMari]], a [[Touhou]] fangame heavily-inspired by the classic Mega Man games.
* [[Mighty No. 9]], a game meant as a spiritual successor by Keiji Inafune, one of the minds behind Mega Man. However, it suffered through multiple complications during development.
* [[Rokkochan (game)|]], an old [[flash]] game that pays homage to classic Mega Man.

title: siege_(arknights)
body:
[i]Siege, leader of the Glasgow Gang, will carve a path for you[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: [spoiler]Alexandrina Victoria[/spoiler]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 10[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Aslan[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]172 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Also known as Vina, the leader of the Glasgow Gang, a squad full of former Londinium street punks which were forced to come to the Island. Her natural command, courage, and composure on the battlefield have made her one of the best operators employed by Rhodes Island. Her choice of weapon is a hammer.

[spoilers]Her real name is Alexandrina Victoria and she is the heir of the Aslan kings to the throne of Victoria. After the assassination of her father, she hid herself in the slums of Londinium where she became the leader of the Glasgow Gang, but she had to flee her homeland along with her entourage and seek refuge at Rhodes Island.

During the Victorian civil war, she returned to Londinium to help the people in need.[/spoilers]

Her characteristics draw many parallels to [[Saber (fate)|]] from the Fate series. Both characters share the same voice actress, have the same animal motifs (lions), and are affiliated with the United Kingdom (the Kingdom of Victoria in Arknights being heavily based on the UK).

She has [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], [[lion ears]] and a [[lion tail]]. She wears [[red_shorts|red]] [[short shorts]], a [[white tank top]], [[black jacket|black]] [[leather jacket]] and [[studded choker]].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Kawasumi Ayako]] (Japanese), Shuang Liang (Chinese), Claudia Jolly (English), and Gabin (Korean). Her art designer is [[Infukun]].

h4. Skins

title: steven_spielberg
body: Steven Allan Spielberg (/ˈspiːlbɜːrɡ/; born December 18, 1946) is an American filmmaker. A major figure of the New Hollywood era and pioneer of the modern blockbuster, Spielberg is widely regarded as one of the greatest film directors of all time and is the most commercially successful director in film history. Among other accolades, he has received three Academy Awards, two BAFTA Awards, and four Golden Globe Awards as well as the AFI Life Achievement Award in 1995, the Knight Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire in 2001, the Kennedy Center Honor in 2006, the Cecil B. DeMille Award in 2009 and the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2015. Seven of his films have been inducted into the National Film Registry by the Library of Congress as "culturally, historically or aesthetically significant".
other_names: スティーヴン・スピルバーグ

title: death_note_(2017)
body: Death Note is a 2017 American supernatural crime thriller film directed by Adam Wingard from a screenplay by Charles Parlapanides, Vlas Parlapanides, and Jeremy Slater, loosely based on [[death note|the manga of the same name]] by Tsugumi Ohba and Takeshi Obata. It stars Nat Wolff, LaKeith Stanfield, Margaret Qualley, Shea Whigham, Paul Nakauchi, Jason Liles, and [[Willem Dafoe]]. The plot follows an American high school student named [[Light Turner]] (portrayed by Wolff), who finds a mysterious supernatural notebook known as the [[Death Note (object)|]] and uses it to murder criminals around the globe under the alias of Kira, while an international detective known only as L (portrayed by Stanfield) seeks to find and arrest him.

title: las_leyendas
body: Leyendas is an animated horror-comedy film franchise created by Ricardo Arnaiz and produced by [[mexico|Mexican]] animation studio Ánima Estudios. It is loosely based on The Reluctant Dragon by Kenneth Grahame. It consists of seven films, a digital television series, and a mobile game. It centers on Leo San Juan, a heroic preteen boy who can communicate with ghosts and monsters; Theodora, a sassy and quirky preteen ghost girl with a know-it-all personality; Sir Andrés, an amicable but loony old knight; Alebrije, a mild-mannered mythological creature; and Finney and Morybetta, two silent calavera children.Set in the early nineteenth century, each of the films is based upon a different Mexican legend.

First game in the [[Seiken Densetsu]] RPG series, originally for the [[Game Boy]]. Released as [i]Final Fantasy Adventure[/i] in North America and [i]Mystic Quest[/i] in Europe.

Later remade for the [[Game Boy Advance]] under the title [i]Sword of Mana[/i]. The remake features distinctly different character designs.

Unlike later games in the franchise, the game features only one playable character, but certain allies (only one at a time) can join and help throughout the game.

title: red_shoes_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

A member of Old Tales squad, alongside [[Cinderella (nikke)|]], [[Little Mermaid (nikke)|]], [[Hansel (nikke)|]] and [[Gretel (nikke)|]]. She and her squad constitute as the successors of the legendary [[Goddess (nikke)|]] squad, having modifications rivaling if not exceeding that of the aforementioned squad.

[spoiler]It was later revealed that Red Shoes is a traitor who was responsible for refining the Corruption code which the [[Rapture (nikke)|]]s use to corrupt Nikkes. Her primary motive for her treason is to gain coexistence with the Raptures. She specifically targeted Cinderella because she was considered the most powerful Nikke in the squad, and is directly responsible for Cinderella's corruption into the [[Heretics (nikke)|Heretic]] "Anachiro", resulting in humanity's defeat against the Raptures.

After her death, the Raptures took her eponymous legwear and Corruption code, implying that they only wanted her weaponry.[/spoiler]

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]], [[orange eyes]] and [[huge breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white leotard]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[armored boots]].
other_names: レッドシューズ(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: sketch
body:
A hasty or undetailed drawing or painting often made as a preliminary study. Traits include rough lines, [[monochrome]] or basic coloring, and left over structural shapes.

Not all pictures with these traits are considered sketches, such as post #2721361 and post #2722170. Posts with proper use of the sketch tag are post #2720851 and post #2722791.

Abbreviated on Pixiv as "rkgk", which comes from the Japanese word for sketch (落書き, [i]rakugaki[/i]). Not all pictured tagged as "sketch" by the artist should be tagged as [[sketch]] on Danbooru. The picture must look like a sketch for it to apply. [b]Translated tags have been removed from this wiki, because artists tend to use this tag in a very misleading way.[/b]

Sketches are not sufficient reasons for flagging. See [[howto:flag]].

Not to be confused with [[sketching]], which is used for when a character within the image is sketching an image themselves.

h4. See also
* [[oekaki]]
* [[squiggle]]
* [[unfinished]]

title: eldritch_abomination
body:
The Eldritch Abomination is a type of creature defined by their complete disregard for the natural laws of the universe as we understand them and the love for body horror. Their physical form (if they even have one) is so bizarre, it even can make someone mad just by looking it. All Lovecraftian Horrors ([[Cthulhu]], [[Hastur]], [[Nyarlathotep]] etc.) are of this type.

h4. External links

title: restless_armour
body:
The [b]Restless Armour[/b] is a type of [[monster]] featured in the [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] series. They resemble [[knight]]s and lack faces.

title: pisaro_knight
body:
The [b]Pisaro Knight[/b] is a male [[Restless Armour]] that appears in [i][[Dragon Quest IV]][/i] as a member of [[Pisaro]]'s army. He wears [[green armor]], differentiating him from other Restless Armours. In the English localization of IV, he is referred to as [b]Sir Roseguardin[/b] or just [b]Roseguardin[/b]. 

In [i][[Dragon Quest Monsters 3]][/i], which takes place in an [[alternate universe]] to IV, he is referred to as [b]Percival[/b].

title: cecily_(dqt)
body: [B]Cecily[/b] is a female [[Restless Armour]] that works as a receptionist in [i][[Dragon Quest Treasures]][/i]. Notably, she has [[pink armour]] and [[white flower]]s painted on one of the pauldrons.

suzuran_(arknights)
body:
[i]Suzuran, Rhodes Island Operator, has nine times the strength, and the fluffiness.[/i]

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Lisa

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Higashi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 9[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vulpo[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]137 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A child prodigy under the guidance of [[Kal'tsit (Arknights)|]] while receiving treatment at Rhodes Island. After she decided to apply to Rhodes Island, she was approved to participate in some low-difficulty tasks under the supervision of other operators.

One of the protagonists of the side story event [i]Twilight of Wolumonde[/i].

Her motif is based on the mythical [[kyuubi|nine-tailed]] [[kitsune|fox]]. Her callsign is [[object namesake|derived]] from the Japanese name of the flower, [i][[lily of the valley]][/i]. Her mother is [[Vulpisfoglia (Arknights)|Vulpisfoglia]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Hondo Kaede]]. Her illustrator is [[sho_(sho_lwlw)|]].

title: bosnia_and_herzegovina
body:
A small country in the Balkans, one of the earlier nations to break off from [[Yugoslavia]].

By the Dayton Agreement, the country is divided into three entities, two federal ones and a condominium between the two: the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina (dominated by the Bosniaks and Croats), [[Republika Srpska]] (dominated by the Serbs), and the Brčko District respectively. 

h4. See also

* [[Sarajevo]]
other_names: ボスニア・ヘルツェゴビナ

title: humanization
body:
Characters that were [b]already humanoid[/b] ([[android]]s, [[furry|furries]], [[monster girl]]s, humanoid [[mecha]], [[elf|elves]], etc) being depicted as more human-like than usual.

This typically involves the reduction, if not outright removal, of non-human features such as [[body fur]], [[horns]], [[wings]], [[colored skin]] or [[pointy ears]]. With furry characters, they are often turned into humans with [[animal ears]]. 

For characters that were not already humanoid, such as [[animal]]s, [[creature]]s, and [[non-humanoid robot]]s, please use [[personification]] instead.

h4. Examples
* !post #7568620
* !post #6258031
* !post #5323932
* !post #4677025

title: joko_widodo
body:
Joko Widodo is the ex-President of Indonesia, in office from 2014 to 2024. Previously he was Mayor of Surakarta from 2005 to 2012 and Governor of Jakarta from 2012 to 2014. He is the first Indonesian president not to have emerged from the country’s political elite or as an army general.

title: penis_envy
body:
A situation where one becomes envious on or feels inferior to another with a visibly larger [[penis]].

Unlike [[breast envy]], the penises do not have to be visible; just the implied reactions while looking down (such as talking about having an "inferior manhood") are enough.

h4. See also

* [[penis size difference]]
* [[small penis humiliation]]
* [[muscle envy]]
* [[penis awe]] 
* [[Tag Group:Body Parts]]

body:

title: envy
body:
The desire to possess something that one lacked.

Not to be confused with [[jealous]], which involves someone who doesn't want to share something that they have, or believed to.

For the Full Metal Alchemist character see: [[Envy (fma)]].
h4. See also
* [[Breast envy]]
* [[Penis envy]]

title: jealous
body:
The desire to retain something that is perceived to belong to oneself - generally held to be possessions, but on this site largely pertains to the affections and intimacy of another person.

Not to be confused with [[envy]], which is the explicit or implicit desire to possess something that someone else has.

[[Touhou]] artists often use [[paru paru]] as the [[sound effects|onomatopoeia]] for jealousy, after [[Mizuhashi Parsee]].

h4. See also
* [[Envy (fma)]]
* [[breast envy]]
* [[penis envy]]

title: exhausted
body: When a character is very tired due to strenuous physical activity or [[exercising]]. See [[sleepy]] for when someone is tired due to lack of sleep.

title: excited
body:
A feeling of great enthusiasm, eagerness, or anticipation.

h4. See also

* [[+_+]]
* [[happy]]

title: disgust
body:
A feeling of strong disapproval or revulsion.

h4. See also

* [[annoyed]]
other_names: 養豚場の豚を見るような目

title: furious
body:
An emotion of deep, unbridled fury. A character who is furious is consumed with anger and is often past rational thinking.

Distinct from [[annoyed|annoyance]] and [[angry|anger]]; a furious character is far beyond the minor to moderate levels of the emotion defined by those tags.

h4. See also

* [[annoyed]]
* [[angry]]
* [[anger vein]]
* [[frown]]
* [[glaring]]
* [[grimace]]
* [[scowl]]
* [[v-shaped eyebrows]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

title: angry
body:
A person who is angry. Especially evident when an [[anger vein]] is present, or when the character is [[glaring]].

Distinct from [[furious|fury]] and [[annoyed|annoyance]]; use this tag when a character is downright mad, but not quite furious and more than simply irritated.

h4. See also

* [[annoyed]]
* [[furious]]
* [[anger vein]]
* [[frown]]

* [[v-shaped eyebrows]]

title: hana_(tokyo_godfathers)
body:
Hana is one of the three main protagonists of Satoshi Kon's [[Tokyo Godfathers]].
Hana is a trans woman, and a former drag queen. She was raised by her foster mother "Mother", another drag queen who took her in after she grew up in foster care as an abandoned child. Hana began to work in "Mother's" drag bar as a singer, but she left after attacking a rude customer who called her an "old fart". Sometime afterward, she met with Gin and Miyuki, and they began their living in [[Tokyo (city)|]] as homeless people.

title: miyuki_(tokyo_godfathers)
body: Miyuki is one of the three main protagonists of the [[Tokyo Godfathers]] movie. She's a runaway girl with a past she can’t talk about. And although she thinks of herself as an independent woman, Hana and Gin have been taking care of her so that she can survive life on the streets.

title: shin_emperor_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]As in 'New' Emperor.[/tn]

French-bred Japanese racehorse. Sired by Siyouni and foaled by Starlet's Sister, he is a full brother to Sottsass, a winner of the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe.

He is notable for being owned by Fujita Susumu, President and CEO of CyberAgent, the parent company of Cygames, who are the creators and developers of [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. Shin Emperor is effectively Mr. Fujita's gamble for the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe.

body:
[b]Vi, the Piltover Enforcer[/b]

A human Champion from Piltover in [[League of Legends]] usually played in the Jungle or as Solo Top. She is known for her giant [[gauntlets]], which she uses to punch things with,  and reckless and rebellious personality. She participates in law enforcement alongside [[Caitlyn (league_of_legends)|]].

The main villain in Piltover and Zaun she tries to catch is [[Jinx (league_of_legends)|]].

title: pee_pad
body: A pad or mat made of absorbent material used as a place for indoor pets to be able to urinate without soiling the floor.  The pads may be disposable or reusable, in which case they'd be washable.  Pee pads are also used together with [[litter box]]es where the litter box is placed in the middle of the pad and the pad is used to catch anything that might spill out when the box is being used.

title: romaji_text
body:
Romaji are Japanese words written in the Latin alphabet. It is seldom used in media, unless for the purpose of educating in the Japanese language or other special purposes. Sometimes used to explain, expound or guide in Kanji/Kana usage.

For Danbooru purposes, the tag refers to instances of Japanese text written in Latin alphabet where Japanese characters would normally be expected. Thus character names, trademarks etc. don't warrant the tag, even if technically they contain romanised Japanese text. Any piece of dialogue, however, as well as sound effects and similar elements which would normally be expected to be understood by Japanese speakers, but are for whatever reason rendered romanised, do qualify.

Do [b]not[/b] use this tag for Japanese words that have been fully incorporated into English, such as "[[sushi]]", "tsunami", or "[[sumo]]"; "senpai" and "sensei" are borderline.

h4. See also

* [[kunreishiki]]
* [[kiriji text]]
* [[pinyin text]]
* [[romaja text]]

title: suiseiseki
body:
[i]Jade Stone[/i]

The third [[Rozen Maiden]] doll, and [[Souseiseki]]'s older [[twins|twin]] [[sisters|sister]]. She battles with her [[watering can]], which she can use to enter dreams. She is mischievous and verbally abusive, but she does seem to care for the other dolls and does not enjoy the Alice Game. Known for saying [[desu]] a lot, which has then reached its memetic status. Inspired the net characters [[Jissouseki]] and [[Eigyouseki]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] in [[twin drills]] and [[red eyes|red]]-[[green eyes|green]] [[heterochromia]]. Her [[lolita fashion|outfit]] consists of a [[white headscarf]] with [[lace]], a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[long dress|long]] [[green dress]] with a [[frilled shirt collar|frilled]] [[collared dress|collar]] tied with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]] and [[long sleeves]], a [[black corset]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black ]] [[shoes]].

title: kylar_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

An aggressive and obnoxious school athlete who enjoys takes great pride in playing on the school's [[lacrosse]] team. Kylar is depicted as a stereotypical jock who is rather unintelligent and prone to violence. In some routes, he displays cases of extremism.

title: jeffrey_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

He is depicted as a socially awkward [[otaku]] and geek, who passionately shares his perverted interests to the female students, much to their discomfort. His interests and personality makes him a constant target for [[bullying]], especially from [[Nicole (class of 09)|Nicole]] and [[Kylar (class of 09)|Kylar]].

title: merc_storia
body:
[b]Merc Storia[/b] (メルクストーリア - 癒術士と鈴のしらべ -), or [b]MerSto[/b] (メルスト), is a mobile role-playing game for Android and iOS, developed by [i]Happy Elements K.K[/i].
The game will be discontinued at 15:00 on February 27, 2025.

title: megan_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

An aspiring actress and honor roll student, Megan's passion and strive for high marks has encouraged her to view herself as superior to her peers. She's known for her arrogance and bossiness, this is depicted in one route where [[Nicole (class of 09)|Nicole]] uses Megan's pride of being in a relationship against her in one route.

A [[hand gesture]] wherein the index and middle, as well as the ring and little fingers are pressed together, while the two pairs are angled away from each other.

If held over the eye with the eye between the fingers then it's also [[v over eye]].

Not to be confused with [[\||/]] or the [[vulcan salute]].

h4. Example

* !post #5879878
* !post #6336657: [[v over eye]]

h4. See also

* [[v]]
* [[w]]
* [[Vulcan salute]] 🖖
* [[\m/]] 🤟
* [[\||/]]
* [[Tag group:Gestures]]

title: scars_all_over
body:
For when a character has [[scar]]s all across their body. Don't use when only a small part of the skin is visible.

In general at-least three of the following should be present:

* [[Scar on face]]
* [[Scar on chest]], [[scar on breasts]], [[scar on back]], or [[scar on stomach]]
* [[Scar on leg]]
* [[Scar on arm]]

h4. See also

* [[Burn scar]]

title: blood_elf_(warcraft)
body:
A race of [[elf|elves]] from the [[Warcraft]] series.  Their notably feature is their [[glowing eyes]] that are usually [[green_eyes|green]] due to their exposure to fel energy and their very long eyebrows.  Similar to other elves from Warcraft their [[pointy ears]] are [[long_pointy_ears|very long]].

They frequently are depicted wearing clothing and armor with the color scheme of red with gold.

They're a derivative of the original Warcraft High Elves, but have turned to Fel energy upon the destruction of the High Elves' Sunwell from which they originally drew their energy upon.

She cosplays as [[Lustalotte (2.5 Jigen no Ririsa)|]].

title: samwise_gamgee
body: Samwise Gamgee (/ˈsæmˌwaɪz ˈɡæmˌdʒiː/, usually called Sam) is a fictional character in J. R. R. Tolkien's Middle-earth. A hobbit, Samwise is the chief supporting character of [[The Lord of the Rings]], serving as the loyal companion (in effect, the manservant) of the protagonist [[Frodo Baggins]]. Sam is a member of the Company of the Ring, the group of nine charged with destroying the One Ring to prevent the Dark Lord Sauron from taking over the world.
other_names: サムワイズ・ギャムジー

title: nerf_maverick_rev-6
body:
The Maverick is a revolver-style blaster with an auto-advancing six-dart cylinder. The Maverick can be reloaded by pressing the button on the left of the blaster to swing the cylinder out, allowing for quick reloading. It has one tactical rail atop the priming slide, followed by a small sight and also a lanyard attachment point. The Maverick's cylinder advances counter-clockwise (when viewed from the front) on trigger pull.

The original blue version of the Maverick is noticeably more powerful than the newer yellow ones, primarily because of a better O-ring.

While the Maverick can accept most Micro Dart and Elite Dart variants, Tagger Micro Darts and Whistler Darts are known to cause jams unless they are fully pushed into the cylinder's barrels.

It was released in 2004

title: back_ribbon
body:
A [[ribbon]] that is tied around the wearer's backside.

Like with determining if the piece of clothing should be tagged as either a [[bow]] or a ribbon, if the bow's tail is far longer than its width, tag it as [b]back ribbon[/b]. Otherwise, it should be tagged as a [[back_bow|back bow]].

title: dreamy_glimmer_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. It could only be acquired through a limited time gacha banner. The appearance of the outfit and its hairstyle are inspired by [[Marilyn Monroe]].

The outfit includes a [[long_dress|long]] [[glitter_dress|glittery]] [[layered_dress|layered]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[mermaid dress]], [[short_gloves|short]] [[frilled_gloves|frilled]] [[black gloves]], [[white stockings]], [[pink footwear|pink]] [[high heels]], a [[black_ribbon|black]] [[ribbon choker]], [[heart earrings]], and a white [[feather boa|fur boa]]. The hairstyle  for the outfit is [[medium hair|medium length]] [[blonde hair]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a red dress and black hair.

title: shiomaneki
body:
Shiomaneki (シオマネキ) is a Japanese word for fiddler crabs. On danbooru, use [[crab]] tag for crustaceans and use [[Mk43L/e]] for a [[mecha|mech]] in [[key_(company)|Key]]'s [[planetarian]].

This tag is currently used for an artist/[[eromanga]]ka.

Japanese name: シオマネキ (Shiomaneki)

h4.Works
* [[Kouzen Waisetsu Kanojo]]
* [[Shoujo kara Shoujo e]]

title: film_strip
body:
A strip of still images that can be played back on a [[projector]] to depict a moving image. Perforations in the sides of the strip allow it to be moved by a projector's mechanism. Film strips can also depict photos taken by a non-video [[camera]].

h4. See also
* [[film reel]]
* [[film strip border]]

title: floral_memory_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it enables [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to fly over vast distances, but only in specific areas of the world map. It can be acquired by players for free by playing through the main story.

The outfit includes a [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[layered_skirt|layered]] [[high-waist skirt]] decorated with [[floral print]] and a [[back bow]], a [[white_shirt|white]] [[sleeveless_shirt|sleeveless]] [[frilled shirt]], [[pantyhose]] that are colored in a [[gradient_legwear|gradient]] from dark blue to gray, [[short_gloves|short]] [[black_gloves|black]] [[frilled gloves]] with [[pearl bracelets]], and [[black_footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. The hairstyle for the outfit is a [[very long hair|very long]] [[gray_hair|gray]] [[high ponytail]] with a black [[hair bow]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a primarily orange and black color scheme, dark brunette hair, and diamond pattern with fruit print on the skirt.

title: pamis_(clover_rose)
other_names: パミス(クローバーローセ)

title: fully_charged_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay it enables [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to fix various electrical devices by playing a simple wire puzzle minigame. It can be acquired for free by playing through the main story.

The outfit includes an [[orange jumpsuit]] accented with green, [[green shoes]], [[green gloves]], [[orange-tinted_eyewear|orange-tinted]] [[goggles]], and [[electrical wire]] worn as [[earrings]]. The hairstyle for the outfit is [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a white, pink, and blue color scheme.
